title: Experienced Virtual Assistant for E-commerce & Marketing
description:
About Us:

MORRY ADV is a dynamic and fast-growing company specializing in affiliate marketing, e-commerce, and lead generation. We are a results-oriented team looking for a smart, proactive, and highly-organized Virtual Assistant to join us and become a key player in our continued growth.



About the Role:

We are looking for a rockstar Virtual Assistant to support our daily operations and marketing efforts. This is a full-time, remote position for a mid-level to experienced VA who can thrive in a fast paced environment. 



Key Responsibilities:

- Conduct market research to identify new trends, competitors, and opportunities.

- Identify and reach out to UGC creators and influencers for our affiliate and e-commerce campaigns.

- Assist with lead generation activities.

- Manage and organize digital files and assets.

- Perform various administrative tasks to support the team.

- Handle other ad-hoc tasks as needed.



The Ideal Candidate:

Is a quick learner, resourceful, and can work independently.

Has excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

Is highly organized, detail-oriented, and efficient.

Is a proactive problem-solver who takes initiative.

Is passionate about digital marketing and eager to learn.



Requirements:

Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant, preferably in e-commerce, affiliate marketing, or lead generation.

Familiarity with Google Workspace and Ecommerce space

Experience with CRM tools, TikTok Shop, Meta Ads Manager, GoHighLevel, Slack, Notion, Airtable, and various affiliate platforms is a huge plus.

Ability to work full-time (40 hours/week) during NYC (GMT-5) business hours.

A reliable high-speed internet connection and a quiet workspace.



What We Offer:

The opportunity to work with a dynamic and supportive team.

A chance to grow your skills and experience in the exciting world of digital marketing.

A stable, long-term position with opportunities for advancement.

If you are a hardworking, smart, and efficient VA who is ready to take on a new challenge, we would love to hear from you!

title: Paid Media Specialist (Part-Time – 4 Hours/Day)
description:
Linc Digital is a performance-driven marketing agency based in Perth, Australia.



We manage SEO, Paid Media, and Web projects for Australian and international clients across construction, home services, professional services, and retail.



We are looking for a part-time Paid Media Specialist to support campaign execution across multiple client accounts, primarily on Google Ads and Meta Ads.



This is not an entry-level role. We are looking for someone with proven, hands-on experience who can manage accounts independently and optimise based on performance data.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



The Role



You will manage day-to-day execution and optimisation of lower-touch paid advertising accounts while working alongside a senior Media Buyer who handles high-touch and large-budget clients.



You must be confident working independently, making optimisation decisions, and escalating risks early.



This is a long-term opportunity for the right person.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Core Responsibilities



- Campaign Management & Optimisation

- Manage Google Ads and Meta Ads campaigns across multiple accounts.

- Monitor daily performance and optimise for CPA, ROAS, CTR, CPC, and conversion rate.

- Structure and execute testing plans (creative, audiences, bidding strategies, placements).

- Identify scaling opportunities and budget adjustments.

- Flag underperforming campaigns early with recommended actions.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Core Responsibilities



- Campaign Management & Optimisation

- Manage Google Ads and Meta Ads campaigns across multiple accounts.

- Monitor daily performance and optimise for CPA, ROAS, CTR, CPC, and conversion rate.

- Structure and execute testing plans (creative, audiences, bidding strategies, placements).

- Identify scaling opportunities and budget adjustments.

- Flag underperforming campaigns early with recommended actions.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Account Setup & Structure



- Build and maintain clean, conversion-focused campaign structures.

- Ensure correct tracking and conversion setup alignment.

- Assist with pixel and tracking troubleshooting where required.

- Maintain naming conventions and internal organisation standards.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Account Setup & Structure



- Build and maintain clean, conversion-focused campaign structures.

- Ensure correct tracking and conversion setup alignment.

- Assist with pixel and tracking troubleshooting where required.

- Maintain naming conventions and internal organisation standards.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Internal Process & Communication



- Maintain strong ClickUp task hygiene:

- Accurate statuses

- Clear optimisation notes

- Time logged daily

- Respond to internal mentions within 1–2 hours during core working hours.

- Escalate issues early when necessary.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Required Experience



- 2–4+ years hands-on Google Ads experience.

- 2–4+ years hands-on Meta Ads experience.

- Proven experience managing multiple ad accounts simultaneously.



Strong understanding of:



- Conversion tracking

- Campaign structure

- Funnel strategy

- Performance metrics

- Experience writing direct-response ad copy.

- Comfortable working with budgets ranging from small to mid-size accounts.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Nice to Have



- Google Ads Certification

- Meta Blueprint Certification

- Experience with Performance Max or YouTube Ads

- Familiarity with GA4 and GTM

- Experience with additional platforms (LinkedIn, TikTok, etc.)



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What This Role Requires



- 4 hours per day (consistent availability required)

- Strong written English

- Reliable internet and workspace

- High attention to detail

- Ability to work without constant direction

- Comfort using ClickUp for all communication and task tracking



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What Success Looks Like



- Campaigns run smoothly without constant oversight.

- Clear testing roadmap in place across accounts.

- Early identification of performance risks.

- Structured, data-backed optimisation decisions.

- Clean documentation and communication.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This Role Is Not For You If



- You rely heavily on automation without understanding strategy.

- You need daily step-by-step instructions.

- You only have experience boosting posts.

- You struggle managing multiple accounts independently.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Ready to Apply?



Please include:



- Resume

- Brief overview of your Google and Meta experience

- Example campaign results (metrics preferred)

- Platforms and tools you have worked with

- A short 1-minute video explaining why you would be a strong fit

- 2 References 

- We are looking for someone reliable, performance-driven, and interested in a long-term working relationship.

title: Short Form Video Editor (Meta, Youtube) Fast Growing Company!
description:
We’re looking for a creative, fast-moving, and detail-oriented Video Editor to join our growing marketing agency. We create high-converting content for platforms like
, Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube. We need someone who can take raw assets and turn ideas into compelling short-form videos that drive results. This role is performance-focused. We don’t just make “nice” videos, we make videos that convert.



More details about our clients and campaigns will be provided during the next round of interviews.



What You’ll Be Doing:



Editing Video Ads:

- Creating direct-response style ads designed to stop the scroll

- Using AI tools and different software platforms to generate video content, voiceovers, visuals, and creative variations

- Incorporating motion graphics, animated text, dynamic transitions, and visual hooks

- Sourcing footage (UGC, stock, royalty-free content, etc.) when needed

- Adding captions, sound effects, background music, and polished finishing touches

- Turning creative briefs into multiple ad variations for testing

- Collaborating with our team to brainstorm and iterate on winning concepts



What We’re Looking For:

- Strong attention to detail, and reliable

- Experience editing short-form ads for social media

- Understanding of what makes a high-performing direct-response video

- Comfortable using multiple tools and learning new AI software quickly

- Motion graphics experience (animated text, overlays, transitions, visual effects)

- Ability to source content independently when needed

- Reply with “Orange” in the subject line so we know you’ve read this post.

- Can follow a creative brief while also bringing new ideas to the table

- Strong English communication skills (you will join brainstorming calls)

- Hard-working, reliable, and growth-oriented



We are looking for is someone that is hard working and detail orientated. We are looking for someone that wants to be a part of our team and grow with our company.



To apply please include:

- Links to previous editing work (especially short-form ads)

- A screenshot of your internet speed from speedtest.net

- 30 second voice recording of what tools you use (Video editing softwares, AI tools, and any others)



We’re looking for someone who wants to grow with us long-term and be part of a fast-moving performance team.

title: Social Community Manager
description:
About Dulcedo



Dulcedo Management began as a high-profile modeling agency and has since evolved into the largest multidisciplinary talent management group in Canada and a leading force in North America. With a steadfast commitment to excellence, our reach extends across all spheres of entertainment, from our offices in Montreal and Toronto to remote collaborations worldwide.



Our talented team of Agents and Account Managers represent and manage the national and international careers of over 500 models, hundreds of Olympic and professional athletes, top-tier digital influencers, content creators, and streamers.



Dulcedo is, above all, a community of incredible individuals who “work hard but play harder.” Our team is united, welcoming, and inclusive, with company culture remaining a top priority. Proudly certified as a Great Place to Work for two consecutive years, our mission is to empower our employees by creating an environment where work feels motivating, creative, and meaningful.



The Opportunity

We’re looking for a strategic, culture-driven, and highly engaged Community Manager to nurture and grow our digital and talent-facing communities. This role is ideal for someone who understands the creator economy, thrives in fast-paced environments, and genuinely loves building meaningful relationships online and offline. You’ll play a key role in strengthening engagement between Dulcedo, our talents, our audiences, and our partners - ensuring our community feels connected, inspired, and aligned with our brand voice.



As Dulcedo continues expanding its international presence, this position offers real opportunity to shape how we cultivate and activate our community at scale.



Scope of Work

Community Engagement & Growth

Build and nurture relationships with our talents, creators, and digital audiences.

Actively engage across social platforms (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, etc.), responding to comments, DMs, and community inquiries.

Develop initiatives to increase engagement, loyalty, and brand affinity.

Identify emerging creators, cultural trends, and community opportunities.

Monitor audience sentiment and feedback.

Assist in organizing online and in-person community activations when required.

Track engagement, growth, and community performance metrics.

Analyze trends and provide insights to optimize strategy.

Prepare monthly community reports with actionable recommendations.





Your Profile

+5 years of experience in community management, social media, or influencer marketing.

Strong understanding of social media platforms and digital culture.

Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal) in English

Strong organizational skills: you're a pro at managing tasks & staying on top of priorities.

Excellent time management and a proactive attitude.

Familiar with Canva for simple design tasks like templates and formatting.

Positive, personable, approachable and you enjoy being part of a collaborative team!



Work Parameters & Perks of Working with Dulcedo

Schedule: Full-time

Work hours aligned with Eastern Time Zone

13th month pay to reward your dedication!

Opportunities to grow. As we build our remote team, you’ll have chances to expand your role!

Mentorship & support because we prioritize people, learning, and your success.

A fun, dynamic environment where collaboration and creativity are part of daily life.

Work from home with a full-time schedule synced with the Eastern Time Zone.

Join a close-knit team where your work has real impact and your contributions are valued.

title: Revenue Manager & Analyst – Short-Term Rentals (PriceLabs)
description:
Job Title: Revenue Manager & Analyst – Short-Term Rentals (PriceLabs)

Job Type: Full-Time, Remote

Company: Moxxi

Location: Tasmania, Australia (Remote role based in the Philippines)



About Moxxi:

We manage 180+ short-term rental properties across Tasmania, Australia. Since 2017, we've hosted over thousands of guests and built a reputation for running things properly, with real systems and a team that actually cares.

We're not a giant corporation. We're a tight, high-performing team that takes pride in the work. If you're the kind of person who opens a spreadsheet and feels something, you'll fit right in.



The Role:

We're looking for a Revenue Manager and Analyst to own our pricing strategy across the entire portfolio.

This isn't a set-it-and-forget-it job. You'll be actively monitoring performance, spotting trends, adjusting rates, and making sure every property is priced to perform. You'll work closely with our leadership team and have real input on decisions that move the needle.



This role suits someone who genuinely enjoys the data side of short-term rentals and wants to grow with a business that's serious about doing things well.



NO AGENCIES PLEASE, WE ARE LOOKING TO GROW OUR TEAM.



What You'll Be Doing:



- Managing dynamic pricing across 170+ properties using PriceLabs / KeyData

- Monitoring occupancy, ADR, and RevPAR daily and adjusting strategy accordingly

- Building and maintaining performance dashboards in Google Sheets

- Identifying underperforming properties and presenting clear recommendations

- Tracking market trends, competitor rates, and seasonal demand shifts

- Preparing weekly and monthly owner performance reports

- Working with leadership on pricing strategy for new property onboarding

- Flagging opportunities to improve revenue before they're missed





What We're Looking For, you'll be a great fit if you:



- Have hands-on experience with PriceLabs (this is essential, not preferred)

- Understand STR metrics (occupancy rate, ADR, RevPAR, booking lead time)

- Love Google Sheets and know how to build reports that are actually useful

- Think in data but communicate in plain language

- Take ownership of your work without needing to be chased

- Are genuinely curious about what the numbers are telling you

- Can spot a problem before it becomes one





What You Don't Need:

You don't need to have managed 180 properties before. You don't need a fancy degree. What you do need is real PriceLabs experience, solid analytical skills, and a genuine interest in doing the work well.



Compensation

Salary: $1,000 to $1,300 USD per month, based on experience.

Opportunity for Performance bonuses for the right Tea
mber.



The Details:

- Full-time, remote position

- Australian business hours AEST (flexibility on start/finish time) Monday to Friday.

- Long-term role with room to grow as we expand

- Monthly performance reviews with clear, honest feedback

- A team that values good work and straight communication





How to Apply:

Send us your application with a video: 



- A short intro about yourself and your STR experience (no essay needed, just be real)

- Your experience with PriceLabs specifically

- An example of a report or dashboard you've built (screenshot or description is fine)



Applications without PriceLabs experience or from Agency won't be progressed.

title: VSL Video Editor
description:
Fascial Labs is a fast-growing health supplement brand looking for a hungry, passionate video editor to produce 90-180 second VSL (Video Sales Letter) ads for Meta 
/Instagram) in 9:16 format.



How it works:



We provide the script. You handle voiceover sourcing and all editing. We have an extensive clip library you can pull from, but you're encouraged to find additional footage when it makes the content hit harder.

What we're looking for:



Someone who understands direct response video — pacing, pattern interrupts, text overlays, retention hooks, and how to keep a viewer locked in for 90+ seconds. Experience in health, wellness, or supplement advertising is a plus but not required. What matters most is that you have a sharp eye, care about the craft, and want to get better with every edit.

The opportunity:



This isn't a one-off gig. We test multiple ad angles weekly and can provide as much work as you want. Your schedule is completely flexible — what matters is the output, not when you do it. Pay is per minute of finished VSL content, with significant performance bonuses when your edits drive results. The better you get, the more you earn.



If you're the kind of editor who obsesses over why one cut converts and another doesn't — and you want to grow alongside a brand that's scaling fast — we want to hear from you.

title: Technical SEO Lead (LLM-Integrated) — WordPress Multisite -  Indexation -  Schema -  AEST
description:
About the role

Own AI-era technical SEO: design entity-first subdomain clusters, control indexation (canonical / meta-noindex / robots), shape JSON-LD schema for AI Overviews, and keep WordPress multisite clean and fast. You’ll also help run an LLM toolchain (Claude Code + Router / OpenRouter / Moonshot / Groq) so teams can prototype content safely and cost-effectively.  



You will:

- Architect 4–10 subdomain clusters with entity graphs and interlink rules  

- Implement and audit canonical, meta-noindex, robots, and sitemaps (Bing + Google)  

- Add and validate schema (Organization, Service, FAQ, HowTo) for SERP and AI-Overview performance  

- Run header cleanup and trust design (no duplicate modules; clean UX)  

- Operate and optimise LLM routing (provider switching, cost caps, response timing logs)  

- Build light SOPs and QA checklists; report weekly indexation KPIs  



Must-haves:

- Hands-on experience with canonical tags, meta-noindex, robots.txt, and sitemaps  

- WordPress multisite management (themes/plugins), with basic PHP and JS familiarity  

- JSON-LD schema implementation (manual or via plugins)  

- Comfortable with LLM tools (any of: Claude Code, OpenRouter, Moonshot/Kimi, Groq)  

- Clear and concise communication skills in English  



Nice-to-haves:

- Bing/Google deindex recovery experience  

- Familiarity with entity clustering and AI Overview content patterns  

- Basic cost/logging discipline (rate limits, max tokens, latency)  



How we work:  

- Trust-first: no PBNs, no link rings, no paid guest-post mills  

- Full-time, 9–5 AEST, remote  

- Daily async stand-up and weekly KPI review  



Compensation:

- Technical SEO Lead (Strategist–Operator): ?100,000–?140,000/month  

- Up to ?150,000 for exceptional fit (proven indexation control + recovery + multisite ops)  

- Senior Implementer (if hired as a pair): ?70,000–?100,000/month  

- Paid practical: ?2,500–?3,500 flat for the 2-hour task  

- Optional performance bump after 60–90 days for sustained KPI wins  



How to apply:

Reply *YES”* and we’ll send you the 2-hour paid practical.

Our smart importing tool enables users to aggregate all their recipes in one platform within seconds - whether those recipes came from an Instagram video, recipe blog or grandma’s recipe box. We’ve been a Top 10 app 
/us/app/recime-recipes-meal-planner/id
in the US App Store’s Food category for months and were recently featured on The Drew Barrymore Show (
/p/DJINm4OzYxX/). We’re profitable, and growing fast - in the last year, our user base has 10x from 500k to 5M users.



Now, we’re looking for an iOS developer with predominately SwiftUI experience to join our small team!



WHAT YOU'LL DO



- Collaborate directly with our CTO (Nic), co-founder (Christine) and a Product Manager to A/B test ReciMe’s product experience and drive innovative new features

- Design, develop, maintain iOS and iPadOS applications.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

- Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.

- Debug and optimise applications for optimal performance.

- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies.



WHAT YOU BRING



- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field.

- At least 3 years of experience in iOS development.

- Proficient in Swift and SwiftUI.

- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks (e.g. Xcode Cloud).

- Knowledge of software design patterns such as MVC, MVP, and MVVM.

- Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to server-side services.

- Experience with third-party libraries and APIs (e.g. Firebase, AlamoFire etc).

- Experience with Git and agile development methodologies.

- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

- Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.

- *Bonus: Any prior startup experience or willingness to take on ownership and wear many hats in a startup.*



DETAILS



- Full-time role

- Fully remote, working with a team across the US, Australia, Philippines and Brazil

- Opportunities to travel for team offsites

- Competitive salary



PERKS



- Be part of one of the fastest growing consumer subscription apps

- Work directly with the founders and a small, hungry team solving a real-world problem

- A product with real retention, real revenue, and real impact

- Opportunities to travel for team offsites - this year, we're traveling to Vietnam!



HOW TO APPLY



To apply, please fill out this Google Form 
 



We’re excited to hear from you!

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
Make sure you read this in full before applying:



Let me guess... You're the sharpest SEO mind in the room. But you're suffocating.



You're tired of presenting killer audit findings that get buried in a developer's "backlog." You’re tired of keyword-stuffed nonsense, begging for tool budgets, and explaining a 301 redirect to your boss for the tenth time.



This isn't just another job post. This is your exit strategy.



We’re not offering you a new title. We’re offering you a war room, an arsenal, and the targets to prove how good you really are.



Who Are We?

My name is Jim Ng. I built this agency on one principle: get clients tangible results, or get out of the way. 

In just a year, we've delivered for over 50 businesses. Now, we have a clear, audacious mission: to 10x our revenue in the next 12 months.



This isn’t a "hope and pray" strategy. It’s a battle plan. We need elite "Digital Warriors" who don't just "do SEO"—they command the search results.



The Stakes: We Put Our Skin in the Game

We don’t hide behind "SEO takes time" excuses. We offer our clients iron-clad guarantees:



- 10% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 3 months.

- 30% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 6 months.

- 60% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 12 months.



Does this scare you, or does it excite you? If your first thought is "That's impossible," keep scrolling. If your first thought is "With my strategy and AI-driven efficiency, I can crush those numbers," then you’re the sniper we want.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing (The Blueprint)

- Architect of Success: You won't just advise on site structure; you’ll build the SEO Bible for our clients. You have the authority to see changes implemented.

- AI Command & Control: You use AI models not as a crutch, but as an exoskeleton. You engineer complex prompts to automate audits, generate schema at scale, and dismantle competitor strategies piece by piece.

- The Sherlock Holmes of Search: You conduct deep-dive technical, content, and backlink audits. You find the opportunities that Screaming Frog and Ahrefs miss because you know how to look beneath the data.

- Translate Data into Dollars: You live in GA4 and Search Console. You ignore vanity metrics. Your focus is singular: qualified organic traffic that drives business growth.



The Specialist’s Code (Is This You?)

- Growth & Mastery: You have 3+ years in the trenches. You see a Google Update as an opportunity to leapfrog the competition, not a crisis.

- Technical Dominance: You speak "developer." You understand CMS limitations, cloud hosting, and how to work with technical teams to get it right the first time.

- AI Power User: You are well-adept in prompt engineering. You know how to use AI to 10x your own output and accuracy.

- Future Leader: You want to be in a commanding position. You aren't looking for a job to hide in; you're looking for a platform to lead and eventually run your own pod.



The Real Pay-Off

- Unleashed Autonomy: You get the freedom to test, experiment, and implement. This is your domain to master.

- Remote Warfare: This is a 100% remote role. We care about the traffic graph moving up and to the right, not what chair you sit in.

- No Nightmare Clients: We protect our warriors. If a client won't implement your expert recommendations, we fire them.

- Empire Building: You are part of the core team. Your successes will be highly visible and critical to our 10x mission.



Ready to Enlist? Here’s where you can apply:





Nothing else will be entertained.

title: Product Owner/Business Analyst (Project Based)
description:
Brisbane Australia based development company C9 - 
 is expanding rapidly and require a Scrum Product Owner or Business Analyst to join the team in a fulltime capacity.



Even if you have applied to other similar positions with us, if you meet the requirements we encourage you to make yourself known again to ensure you are still interested and your circumstances have not changed.



We are looking for a dedicated product owner to be the point person in our software development scrum team.

The Product Owner will be responsible for defining the software product vision and managing the software product development process.



Other responsibilities include supporting the scrum team, managing backlog items, and optimizing the value of the product(s).

You should also be able to lead the product development team toward achieving the vision and mission of the organization.



As a Product Owner, you should have the ability to plan and manage the development project from start to finish, and ensure that the product(s) meet the customers needs.

Ultimately, a top-notch Product Owner will be detail-oriented and have excellent organizational, leadership, and communication skills.



Product Owner Responsibilities:

- Take the lead of scrum teams as the Product Owner

- Providing vision and direction to the Agile development team and stakeholders throughout the project and create requirements

- Ensure that the team always has an adequate amount of prior prepared tasks to work on

- Plan and prioritize product feature backlog and development for the product

- Define product vision, road-map and growth opportunities

- Assess value, write/develop user stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy.

- As needed, do project scoping and write software requirements specification documents and any other documents like wireframes, mockups etc. to aid in understanding the project requirements

- Provide backlog management, iteration planning, and elaboration of the user stories

- Work closely with Product Management to create and maintain a product backlog according to business value

- Lead the planning product release plans and set the expectation for delivery of new functionalities

- Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release/Sprint Goals

- Research and analyze market, the users, and the roadmap for the product

- Follow competitors and the clients related industry

- Keep abreast with Agile/Scrum best practices and new trends



Product Owner Requirements:

- Bachelors degree in computer science, information technology, or a relevant field preferred.

- Previous working experience as a product owner.

- In-depth knowledge of Agile methodologies.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

- Strong communication skills, written and verbal.

- Strong presentation skills.

- Ability to multi-task and work under pressure.





If you believe you have the right skills and attitude to work in our fast paced team working across multiple projects then please submit your CV and cover letter through Online Jobs.





Must be able to work Australian Times(8:45 - 18:00 AEST) and Holidays





A high level of speaking & written English are mandatory to apply.

title: Full-Time Graphic Designer (Meta Ads + Advertorial Landing Pages)

title: Senior Technical Solar Operations & Product Specialist  (Technical Right Hand — Quality & Product Expertise)
description:
Role Overview  

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented technical specialist to become the technical backbone of our solar operations.



ABOUT US: We are building an exciting solar technology platform to help our clients on their journey to reduce their energy costs. We are small team at present with 2 of our team also from the Philippines, but we plan to grow rapidly and need to build an exciting, passionate team.



This role exists to ensure every project is technically correct, clearly documented, and ready for smooth installation. You will work closely with sales, installers, and customer service to make sure the right products are selected, job packs are accurate, and technical details are never missed.



You will not be responsible for full system design from scratch. Instead, your role is to validate, refine, and optimise proposals created in OpenSolar.



You will play a key role in ensuring technical excellence and freeing up leadership to focus on growth.



???? Core Responsibilities



1?? Technical Job Pack Ownership

- Review and refine job packs before installation.  

- Ensure installers receive clear, detailed, and practical instructions.  

- Identify missing details, risks, or inconsistencies.  

- Improve job pack quality and technical clarity across all projects.  

- Translate sales outcomes into installation-ready technical information.



2?? OpenSolar Proposal Review & Technical Optimisation

Using OpenSolar, you will:

- Review proposals built by the team and ensure technical accuracy.  

- Adjust configurations where needed to align with real-world installation requirements.  

- Validate system sizing, product selection, and compatibility.  

- Ensure pricing and technical recommendations align with customer needs.  

- Work with sales to deliver technically sound solutions quickly.



This role focuses on technical oversight and optimisation rather than full system design.



3?? Product Selection & Technical Expertise

A core part of this role is having an in-depth understanding of solar and battery products, knowing which solution suits which scenario.



Experience with products such as:

- Tesla Powerwall  

- SunGrow  

- GoodWe  

- Selectronic  

- Sigenergy  

- RedEarth  



You should understand:

- Which products suit different customer goals.  

- Compatibility between inverters, batteries, and system layouts.  

- Strengths and limitations of different brands.  

- Practical installation considerations.



4?? Installer Liaison & Technical Assurance

- Act as the technical bridge between office and field teams.  

- Liaise with installers to confirm correct setup and execution.  

- Answer technical questions and remove uncertainty before installation.  

- Help maintain consistent installation standards.



5?? Technical Support & Problem Solving

- Support customer service with technical troubleshooting.  

- Help diagnose and resolve client issues efficiently.  

- Communicate technical information clearly to non-technical people.  

- Ensure customers receive confident and professional technical support.



???? Ideal Candidate

You are someone who:

- Naturally catches details others miss.  

- Understands solar systems beyond software outputs.  

- Knows how to choose the right product for the right scenario.  

- Thinks practically about real-world installs.  

- Enjoys improving systems and reducing mistakes.



???? Required Skills & Experience

- Strong experience using OpenSolar (reviewing and refining proposals).  

- Solid understanding of solar + battery system operation.  

- Deep knowledge of major inverter and battery ecosystems.  

- Experience preparing or reviewing technical documentation/job packs.  

- Ability to communicate effectively with installers and sales teams.  

- Strong troubleshooting mindset.



? Highly Desirable

- Hybrid or off-grid knowledge.  

- Electrification knowledge (EV charging, heat pumps, etc.).  

- Experience improving operational workflows.  

- Field installation or commissioning experience.



???? Success in This Role Looks Like

- Job packs are extremely clear and detailed.  

- Installers are confident and rarely need clarification.  

- Product selections are optimised for each situation.  

- Technical issues are solved quickly.  

- Sales moves faster because technical decisions are validated early.



???? Who Will Thrive In This Role

We are looking for someone who genuinely enjoys technical accuracy and takes pride in getting things right the first time.



You will likely succeed in this role if you:

- Notice details that others miss.  

- Think ahead and prevent problems before they happen.  

- Care about quality and long-term outcomes — not just completing tasks.  

- Enjoy improving systems and making things clearer and smoother.  

- Are comfortable taking ownership rather than waiting for instructions.



This is not a role for someone who wants to simply follow a checklist.  

It is a role for someone who wants to become the trusted technical right hand in a growing solar

title: Meta Ads Specialist (Creative-Led & Results-Driven)
description:
We’re a fast-moving digital agency delivering real results across real estate, construction, e-commerce, and events. No fluff. No cookie-cutter campaigns. Just performance-led marketing that converts. We’re now looking for a high-level Meta Ads Specialist who can run the show—strategy, creative, execution—without hand-holding.

________________________________________

???? What You’ll Be Doing:

• Plan, build, and manage Meta Ads campaigns that generate leads and sales

• Create standout creatives that go beyond standard Canva templates—think engaging Reels, UGC-style videos, scroll-stopping graphics

• Write sharp, conversion-focused copy tailored to each audience

• Continuously optimise and test to achieve the lowest possible CPL and highest ROAS

• Handle full Pixel installation, tracking, and event setup

• Build custom and retargeting audiences across the full funnel

• Integrate with CRMs (via Zapier) and ensure lead flows are smooth and tracked

• Take initiative on what’s working, what’s not, and what needs to be tested next

• Provide clean, actionable reporting weekly (no fluff)

________________________________________

? What We’re Looking For:

• 3+ years hands-on experience managing Meta Ads (with proof of results)

• Strong creative skillset — you can ideate, design, and execute your own visuals and content

• Sharp copywriting skills tailored to different industries and tones

• Advanced knowledge of Meta Business Manager, Ads Manager, Events Manager

• CRM integration experience (Zapier essential)

• Pixel & conversion tracking mastery

• Able to work independently and bring solutions, not problems

• A forward-thinker who’s proactive, not reactive

• Bonus if you’ve worked with real estate, fitness, or service-based clients

________________________________________

???? We’re Not Looking For:

• Someone who waits to be told what to do

• Someone who only copies competitor ads

• Someone who can't interpret data and adjust accordingly

________________________________________

To Apply:

Send us:

• A quick intro

• Examples of your best performing ads (and results)

• Sample creatives or a portfolio

• Your rates and availability

title: Backend Specialist
description:
Full-time | Remote | 5PM–1AM PH



We're looking for someone who genuinely enjoys making messy systems make sense.



You’ll work alongside a lead to build and maintain clean, scalable backend systems (primarily in Zoho) for our clients.



Architecture decisions sit with the lead, but this is collaborative. We want your input. If you see a better way to structure something, say it. We build together.



We design systems that still make sense 12 months from now, not quick fixes that break next quarter.



What You'll Do

- You'll be hands-on building backend systems, primarily in Zoho CRM



That includes:

- Building CRM modules and layouts

- Creating and maintaining workflow rules

- Supporting automation logic

- Creating forms, structured data flows, dashboards

- Troubleshooting broken processes and identifying root causes

- Documenting clearly

- Exploring new tools as projects evolve



We like backend thinkers. If something feels inefficient or unclear, you raise it.



What We're Looking For

- You have hands-on experience building backend systems inside a CRM (HubSpot, Salesforce, Zoho, Pipedrive, etc.). That part is non-negotiable.

- Zoho CRM experience is strongly preferred, but if you've built clean systems in another CRM and can demonstrate strong backend logic, we're open.



You:

- Can build workflow rules independently

- Think in systems, not just tasks

- Prefer root cause over surface fixes

- Document as you go

- Stay calm when debugging

- Understand backend cause-and-effect



If someone points you to CommandCenter, a new Zoho app, or asks you to build an Excel macro - you won’t freeze. You'll test, experiment, and figure it out.



Bonus if you've worked with:



- Zoho Checkout, Creator, Forms

- Zapier or Make

- Spreadsheet logic (Excel / Google Sheets)

- Google Apps Script



Even better if you occasionally say:  “Here’s what I'd suggest instead.” We like people who care enough to think!



How We Work:



- Open collaboration

- Ownership without ego

- Clear communication

- Sustainable pace

- Serious about good systems, serious about being decent humans



If this sounds like your kind of work, send us your application along with a short 1-2 minute video intro. Tell us about a backend system you built and what you'd improve if you rebuilt it today.

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer / Technical Co-Founder (SaaS Messaging Platform)
description:
Location: Remote

Type: Full-time 



Overview:

We are looking for a visionary Full-Stack Developer to build a next-generation Instagram automation and CRM platform from the ground up. If you look at platforms like ManyChat, SleekFlow, or 
 and think, "I can build a more scalable, smarter, and enterprise-ready version of this," we want to talk to you.



This is not just a "feature-building" job. You will architect a high-traffic SaaS environment that handles 

multiple  of real-time webhooks and automates complex business workflows.



Your Responsibilities:

Architecture: Design and build a robust, scalable backend capable of processing high volumes of concurrent messages and data (e.g., Node.js, Python, or Go).



Instagram & Meta API Integration: Deep-dive into the Meta Graph API to handle DMs, comments, story mentions, and automated triggers. So we need someone that also knows the Instagram, Meta, ... guidelines.



Workflow Engine: Develop a visual "Drag & Drop" flow builder or a high-performance logic engine for automated customer journeys.



Database Management: Build a multi-tenant database structure (PostgreSQL/Redis) that ensures data isolation and lightning-fast retrieval for analytics.



Frontend: Create a sleek, intuitive dashboard for businesses to manage their conversations (React/Next.js).

Compliance & Scaling: Ensure the platfor
ets Meta’s official requirements and scales horizontally as our user base grows.



Requirements:

SaaS Experience: Proven track record of building and launching a SaaS product from scratch.



Messaging Expert: You have extensive experience with the Meta Graph API (Instagram/Facebook/WhatsApp) and understand its limitations and approval processes.



Backend Heavyweight: Strong expertise in real-time systems, Webhooks, and API design.



Product Thinker: You don't just write code; you understand the user journey and how to build a competitive advantage against established players.



Tech Stack: Proficiency in [e.g., Node.js, React, PostgreSQL, Docker, AWS/GCP].



What we offer:

The chance to build a core product from day one with total technical freedom.

Competitive compensation (Salary + Equity options for the right candidate).

Fast-paced, "builder" culture without corporate red tape.



Are you ready to build the next big thing in Social Commerce?

Apply now with your portfolio or a link to a SaaS project you’ve built!



We need prove that you are expirienced

title: Advanced YouTube Documentary Editor (Full-Time, Long-Term, 48h Turnaround)
description:
Before applying, read this entire post carefully. If you do not meet any of the requirements below, do not apply.



We are building a high-quality YouTube documentary channel focused on natural disasters and major catastrophic events that have impacted the world. Our content explores earthquakes, tsunamis, hurricanes, volcanic eruptions, extreme weather events, survival stories, and large-scale crises through structured, research-driven storytelling with cinematic intensity and professional production value.



We are hiring a full-time experienced video editor for a long-term collaboration starting immediately.



The initial workload is 12 videos per month (3 per week), with an average duration of around 40 minutes per video.



Turnaround Time (Non-Negotiable)



Each video must be delivered within 48 hours.

This deadline is strict. Consistency and speed are critical.

If the 48-hour turnaround is not respected, the collaboration will end.



Compensation



The rate is $0.5 USD per finished minute.



If a video is 40 minutes long, the payment will be $20 per video.



At 12 videos per month, this equals approximately $250 per month.



We manage multiple YouTube channels (36+ channels), and we are looking for someone who can scale with us.



If production scales to 36 videos per month, the total monthly payment would be approximately:



36 videos × $20 = $720–$750 per month,

depending on the total number of finished minutes delivered at the end of the month.



Payment scales based on total delivered minutes.



Important: Ability to Scale



We are looking for someone who has the capacity to build or manage a small team of editors if necessary.



The goal is to scale production up to 36 videos per month across multiple channels.



If you have your own editing team or the ability to manage additional editors under your supervision, that is a major advantage.



We are building long-term and need someone who can grow with the operation.



Editing Quality Requirements



This is NOT basic stock editing.



These videos require high-quality cinematic B-roll.

No low-quality random stock footage.



Footage must be sourced professionally from:



Storyblocks (mandatory active subscription required)



Licensed YouTube footage used correctly



High-quality archival sources



You must understand how to properly use footage to avoid copyright issues. We are looking for someone with real YouTube experience who understands Content ID, fair use, and platform policies to prevent claims and strikes.



We are looking for an advanced editor only.



You Must:



Have strong experience editing for YouTube channels



Understand how the YouTube platform works



Know how to avoid copyright claims and strikes



Be experienced in long-form documentary storytelling



Replicate the exact style of the reference videos



Have strong cinematic pacing and tension-building skills



Be proficient in After Effects and motion graphics



You must carefully study and match the style of these reference videos:















Do not apply if you cannot match this level.



Work Commitment



Must be able to work at least 10 hours per day if required



Capable of handling up to 36 videos per month



Deliver consistently within 48 hours



Maintain structured workflow and production discipline



Mandatory Test Edit



To be considered, you must complete the mandatory 1-minute test edit:







Once we receive your test edit and it meets our standards, we begin immediately.



We are building at scale and require discipline, speed, advanced skill, and long-term commitment.



Apply only if you are serious and capable of operating at a professional level.

title: Marketing coordinator
description:
About the Company

ABC Garage Doors and Repair is a growing local company serving the Washington DC and Baltimore metropolitan regions including DC, Maryland, Virginia and Baltimore. We are expanding into additional markets and are looking for a strong marketing professional who can help accelerate that growth.

Visit us at 



What Sets Us Apart

Our company is built on core values that guide everything we do.

• Providing a world class experience for each customer.

• Reliability and consistency in every service call.

• Honest and professional communication with clients.

• Craftsmanship that focuses on quality and attention to detail.

• Professionalism from the first phone call to the final follow up.



Role Overview

The Marketing Coordinator will start as a part time remote position with the opportunity to grow into full time based on performance. This role is the central point of coordination for all marketing activity. You will manage outside vendors and teams while also stepping in to create content or complete tasks directly whenever needed. You will help move marketing projects from idea to execution and keep everything organized, tracked and aligned with company goals.



Key Responsibilities

• Create social media posts using AI tools and schedule content across
, Instagram and TikTok.

• Monitor SEO progress, track rankings and coordinate with SEO specialists.

• Manage and monitor Google Ads and coordinate with any external ad managers.

• Listen to inbound phone calls and categorize calls by source such as ads, yard signs or other campaigns.

• Support new marketing initiatives including cold calling campaigns, door knocking projects and sales team setup.

• Maintain Google My Business listings and respond to reviews when needed.

• Work inside Canva to create marketing materials and visuals.

• Assist with reporting, analytics and performance tracking across all marketing channels.

• Coordinate marketing vendors and freelance teams and hire help when needed.

• Take ideas from leadership, break them into tasks and convert them into actionable projects.



Required Experience and Skills

• Two to five years of experience in marketing or a related field.

• Strong knowledge of social media, SEO, Canva and digital marketing tools.

• Fast learner who can pick up new software quickly.

• Creative thinker who can produce ideas and act on them without needing hand holding.

• Organized, high energy, data driven and able to manage multiple projects at once.

• Excellent problem solving skills and the ability to think outside the box.



Preferred Skills, but not required

• Google certifications.

• Experience with WordPress, basic HTML or simple website updates.

• Past experience managing outside vendors or freelancers.



Work Style and Culture Fit

• Independent, imaginative and driven.

• Understands instructions quickly and can turn loose ideas into real projects.

• Thrives in a supportive but high accountability culture.

• Able to collaborate closely with company leadership.

• Comfortable being the main marketing lead and helping build a larger team over time.



Marketing Goals You Will Support

• Increasing inbound leads across all markets.

• Helping find new cost effective lead generation strategies beyond Google PPC.

• Expanding the company into new service areas.

• Improving reporting, tracking and overall marketing performance.



Campaigns You Will Work On

• Social media campaigns

• Yard sign projects

• Google Local Services Ads

• Google Ads

• Seasonal promotions

• SEO management

• Reporting and analytics

title: Content strategist
description:
We’re looking for an experienced, data-driven Content Strategist to plan and optimize our monthly content across Instagram and YouTube. This role is focused on building a full-funnel content strategy (top, middle, and bottom of funnel) that drives audience growth, engagement, and conversions.



You must understand what is currently working in our niche, what’s not, and how to translate insights into a clear, actionable content calendar for both long-form and short-form video.



?



Key Responsibilities

 • Develop a monthly content strategy and posting schedule for:

 • Instagram (Reels, carousels, posts, stories)

 • YouTube (long-form + Shorts)

 • Research and analyze what’s performing in our niche

 • Identify content gaps and new growth opportunities

 • Create clear content pillars and themes

 • Provide hook, angle, and topic recommendations

 • Optimize content for:

 • Reach and discoverability

 • Audience retention

 • Engagement and conversions

 • Review analytics and continuously refine the strategy

 • Collaborate with the team on content direction and priorities



?



Requirements

 • Proven experience as a Content Strategist or Social Media Strategist

 • Strong understanding of Instagram and YouTube algorithms

 • Demonstrated success growing accounts via short-form and long-form video

 • Experience building full-funnel content strategies

 • Ability to analyze competitors and niche trends

 • Data-driven mindset (comfortable with metrics and insights)

 • Excellent communication and strategic thinking skills

 • Ability to deliver clear, structured monthly plans

description:

title: Zoho One Specialist/Tech Ops Specialist
description:
Full-time | Remote | 5PM–1AM PH



We're looking for someone who genuinely enjoys making messy systems make sense.



You'll work alongside a lead to build and maintain clean, scalable Zoho systems for our clients.



Architecture decisions sit with the lead, but this is collaborative. We want your input. If you see a better way to structure something, say it. We're building together.



We build systems that still make sense 12 months from now, not quick fixes that break next quarter.



What You’ll Do



You’ll be hands-on inside Zoho CRM.



That includes:

- Building CRM modules and layouts

- Creating and maintaining workflow rules

- Supporting automation logic

- Creating forms and structured data flows

- Troubleshooting broken processes and identifying root causes

- Documenting clearly

- Learning new Zoho tools as projects evolve



We value builders who think, not just follow instructions. If something feels off, unclear, or unnecessarily complicated - speak up.



What We're Looking For:

You have hands-on Zoho CRM experience.

You can build workflow rules independently.



You're technical enough to tinker. If someone points you to CommandCenter or a new Zoho app, or asks you to create an Excel macro, you won't freeze - you’ll test, read, experiment, and figure it out.



You probably:

Think in systems, not just tasks

Prefer solving the root cause over quick fixes

Document as you go

Stay calm when debugging

Enjoy understanding how backend pieces connect



Bonus if you've worked with:

Zoho Checkout, Creator, Forms

Zapier or Make

Spreadsheet logic (Excel/Google Sheets)

Google Apps Script

Even better if you occasionally say: “Here's what I'd suggest instead.” - We like people who care enough to think!



How We Work:

- We collaborate openly

- We care about mental health and sustainability

- We value ownership without ego

- We solve problems calmly

- We don't expect perfection, but we do expect clarity

- We're serious about good systems

- We're also serious about being decent humans



If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you. Send us your application along with a short 1-2 minute video intro telling us a bit about your experience and how you approach backend problems.

title: Cinematic Video Editor — AI-Native Storytelling
description:
JOB TITLE: Cinematic Video Editor — AI-Native Luxury Storytelling

SALARY: 1100 USD/Month

TYPE: Full-time (40 hours/week)

LOCATION: Remote (Philippines)

SCHEDULE: Async, with Vancouver overlap (PST) for feedback



THE MISSION

Prismiera is a luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series — stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and beauty told through museum-grade aesthetics. Our shorts should feel cinematic, elegant, hypnotic, visceral, and expensive. (Be prepared to innovate as demands and trends change.)

You will receive scripts, AI tool access, and style references. Your job is to build the scene: generate AI visuals, source archival footage, layer sound design, add voiceover from elevenlabs, and deliver shorts where every second earns the next.

We are hiring for taste, cinematic instinct, and the ability to treat AI generation as a serious production tool.



THE STYLE

Multiple styles as demand and trends change; Dark luxury. Museum. Stylish and lethal. Rich textures. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention. Every cut has a reason.

Not: default presets, stock photo slideshows.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

Produce vertical shorts (YouTube Shorts / TikTok / Reels) end-to-end using our scripts, style kits, and current channel benchmarks:



Edit: Assemble 30-120s vertical shorts with elegant pacing and restraint. The voiceover leads — visuals serve. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate.

Generate: Create supporting visuals using AI image and video tools (Seedream, Veo, Kling, and whatever launches next). We provide all paid accounts and internal prompting workflows — you bring creative judgment and iteration speed.

Music & Sound: Beat-matching, swells, drops, and silence to drive visual storytelling. You understand rhythm as an editing tool — not decoration.

Product Integration: Place static jewelry photos into moving scenes so they look physically present — masking, light/shadow matching, subtle color grading. Convincing realism, not floating stickers. (AI can handle lot of this, but requires a good eye for it.)

Finish: Minimal kinetic typography + copyright-safe or licensed classical/atmospheric audio (Generated via Suno).

File Hygiene: Clean bin structure, naming conventions. Project files and assets uploaded Notion/
.





CORE REQUIREMENTS



The Eye. You instinctively know the difference between luxury and cheap. Starting out, you'll receive reference videos of our current benchmarks and experimental formats. Your job is to match that standard consistently and innovate on top of them.

Voiceover-First Storytelling. You edit to narration first, music second. You never bury a punchline under a flashy transition.

Retention Instinct. The first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually. Every 2–3 seconds, something changes.

AI Fluency. You're comfortable generating, iterating, and curating AI output across image and video tools. You treat generation as production — prompting, reviewing, selecting, and refining until the output meets the standard.

Adobe Premiere Pro. Required for project handoffs and consistency.

Strong English. Daily async communication — clear, direct, and professional.

Reliable & Coachable. You hit deadlines or warn early. You take direct feedback and iterate fast. You flag problems with options, not excuses.



Bonus (not required, but noticed):

After Effects compositing, Mocha tracking, advanced color grading, sound design beyond music (SFX layering, risers, hits).



VOLUME & DELIVERABLES



Ramp-up (first 2–3 weeks): 2–3 shorts/week as you learn the brand voice and pipeline

Steady state: Push to 4 high quality vertical shorts per week.

Deliverables: 1080×1920 minimum, 30fps, MP4 (H.264)





SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS



RAM: 16GB minimum (32GB preferred) + SSD

Reliable high-speed internet (upload speed matters)

Must run Premiere Pro and browser-based AI tools simultaneously without issue





PAID TRIAL (Shortlisted Candidates)

Before any full-time commitment, we run a paid weekly trial. We provide scripts, elevenlabs access for voiceover, and style references/benchmarks. You deliver 30–50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week. If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to bi-weekly payments of $550 (before work).

This protects both sides — you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



WHAT WE OFFER



Paid accounts for all frontier AI tools

Creative identity — you're building the visual language of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

Clear briefs — scripts, audio files, mood boards, and reference videos for every batch

Direct feedback — specific, constructive notes on every edit

A brand worth building — Prismiera launches soon, with a second and third AI-native brands after that, which cover a wide variety of content scopes. You're helping build the machine.





OWNERSHIP & CONFIDENTIALITY

All outputs (edits, project files, prompts, generated assets) are Prismiera property and must remain confidential. 



HOW TO APPLY

Important: Use at least 7 Apply Points when applying on OnlineJobs.ph.

Subject line: PRISMIERA EDITOR — [Your Favorite Historical Art Era]

Send only the following (numbered exactly):



Portfolio. Links to your 3 best vertical shorts (mood/atmosphere preferred — not vlogs). Label one that demonstrates music-driven pacing.

The Story Test. Link to ONE short that includes voiceover or spoken dialogue. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script. (Can overlap with #1.)

Luxury Test (3–5 bullets). How do you make an edit feel "expensive" instead of "cheap"?

AI Experience (1–2 sentences). What is your experience level with generative AI tools? If none, say so — we'll evaluate the rest on its own merits.

Technical (exactly 3 sentences). Describe your approach to compositing a static product photo into a moving scene so it looks physically present.

Specs. PC specs (CPU / GPU / RAM / SSD) + internet upload speed (screenshot preferred).

Integrity (1–2 sentences). Describe a time you missed a deadline or made a mistake — what did you do next?

The Rewrite. Rewrite this sentence in a cinematic tone: "She is really cool and strong and she wins."

title: Executive & Marketing Assistant (PST Hours)
description:
Job Posting: Executive & Marketing Assistant (PST Hours)

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Schedule: Full-Time or Part-Time, PST Business Hours (Graveyard Shift in PH)

Communication: WhatsApp, Meta Messenger, ClickUp



The Role

We are looking for a rockstar Executive & Marketing Assistant to be the right hand to a high-level entrepreneur. This isn't just data entry; we need a strategic thinker who understands funnels, project management, and content creation. You will be responsible for keeping the engine running while I focus on big-picture growth.



Key Responsibilities

Marketing Tech Stack: Manage and build within GoHighLevel (GHL) and ClickFunnels.

* Certifications and awards are a PLUS. 



Project Management: Maintain tasks and deadlines inside ClickUp.



Executive Support: Calendar management,
 correspondence, and daily check-ins via WhatsApp/Messenger.



Content Creation: Basic to intermediate Video Editing (Reels, TikToks, or YouTube clips).



Communication: High-level English proficiency (written and verbal).



Requirements

Proven experience with GHL and ClickFunnels (CRM & Funnel logic).



Experience in ClickUp or similar PM tools (Asana/Monday).



Video Editing / Content Creation plus AI creatives 



Reliable high-speed internet and a quiet workspace for PST hours.



A "figure-it-out" attitude—you are a problem solver, not just a task-taker.



EXPECTATIONS: 

10-40 hours weekly, depending on experience and performance.

Must be available PST Pacific Standard Time U.S.



PAY (negotiable): 

Starting Monthly: approximately $465.00 - $565.00 per month (?26,500 - ?32,300 per month) | Hourly: approximately $3.00 per hour (?171 per hour)

title: Meta Ads Specialist (Creative-Led & Results-Driven) - READ DESCRIPTION BEFORE APPLYING!!!
description:
We’re a fast-moving digital agency delivering real results across real estate, construction, e-commerce, and events. No fluff. No cookie-cutter campaigns. Just performance-led marketing that converts. We’re now looking for a high-level Meta Ads Specialist who can run the show—strategy, creative, execution—without hand-holding.

________________________________________

???? What You’ll Be Doing:

• Plan, build, and manage Meta Ads campaigns that generate leads and sales

• Create standout creatives that go beyond standard Canva templates—think engaging Reels, UGC-style videos, scroll-stopping graphics

• Write sharp, conversion-focused copy tailored to each audience

• Continuously optimise and test to achieve the lowest possible CPL and highest ROAS

• Handle full Pixel installation, tracking, and event setup

• Build custom and retargeting audiences across the full funnel

• Integrate with CRMs (via Zapier) and ensure lead flows are smooth and tracked

• Take initiative on what’s working, what’s not, and what needs to be tested next

• Provide clean, actionable reporting weekly (no fluff)

________________________________________

? What We’re Looking For:

• 3+ years hands-on experience managing Meta Ads (with proof of results)

• Strong creative skillset — you can ideate, design, and execute your own visuals and content

• Sharp copywriting skills tailored to different industries and tones

• Advanced knowledge of Meta Business Manager, Ads Manager, Events Manager

• CRM integration experience (Zapier essential)

• Pixel & conversion tracking mastery

• Able to work independently and bring solutions, not problems

• A forward-thinker who’s proactive, not reactive

• Bonus if you’ve worked with real estate, fitness, or service-based clients

________________________________________

???? We’re Not Looking For:

• Someone who waits to be told what to do

• Someone who only copies competitor ads

• Someone who can't interpret data and adjust accordingly

________________________________________

To Apply:

Send us:

• A quick intro

• Examples of your best performing ads (and results)

• Sample creatives or a portfolio

• Your rates and availability

title: Executive Assistant - Property Management
description:
Location: Remote (Work from Home - Must have home computer & internet)

Position Type: Independent Contractor with Benefits. 



Join Our Property Management Team!

We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Leasing Agent & Assistant Property Manager. This is a dynamic, dual-focused role where your exceptional people skills and organizational abilities will be key to ensuring tenant satisfaction and the smooth operation of our properties. The ideal candidate will be the primary point of contact for our tenants, excelling in both customer service and the efficient coordination of all property maintenance requests.



FULL-TIME (40 working hours/week)

Work Availability Requirement: Monday-Friday 7AM – 7PM U.S. Pacific Time

(will not be working the entire time frame, however availability requested. Work is still 40 hours / week)

“On Call” for Emergencies/Priorities during other times



Key Responsibilities

This role is centered around two core areas: Customer Service & Leasing and Maintenance Coordination.



Customer Service & Leasing

• Tenant Relations: Serve as the primary, friendly point of contact for all current and prospective tenants, fostering a positive and professional landlord-tenant relationship.

• Inquiry Management: Promptly and professionally respond to all tenant inquiries, questions, and concerns via phone,
, and in-person communication.

• Leasing Activities: Conduct property showings for prospective tenants, answer questions about the units and community, and process rental applications.

• Administrative Support: Assist with the preparation, execution, and renewal of lease agreements, ensuring all documentation is accurate and legally compliant.

• Issue Resolution: Handle tenant complaints and conflicts with empathy and a problem-solving mindset, escalating complex issues to the Property Owner/Manager when necessary.



Maintenance Coordination

• Request Intake: Receive, log, and prioritize all incoming maintenance and repair requests from tenants.

• Vendor Management: Coordinate and schedule maintenance and repair work with approved vendors and contractors.

• Follow-Up & Quality Control: Proactively follow up with tenants and vendors to ensure all maintenance requests are completed in a timely manner and to a high standard of quality.

• Communication: Maintain clear and consistent communication with tenants regarding the status and estimated completion time of their maintenance requests.

• Record Keeping: Maintain accurate and detailed records of all maintenance work orders, expenditures, and service history.



Preferred Qualifications and Skills

• Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.

• A proactive, problem-solving attitude and the ability to work independently.

• Quick thinking and verbal articulation in English (for example a skill used in cold calling and handling objections or concerns on the phone)

• Comfortable with phone communication and soft selling on the phone

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, particularly in managing multiple tasks and deadlines.

• Proficiency with standard office software (e.g., Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace).

• Proven experience in a customer service or administrative (or property management-

related role).



What We Offer

• Salary: Up to $500-$800 per month

• Supportive Environment: A direct working relationship with the Property Owner/Manager and a focus on professional growth.

• Long-term stability



About Us:

We’re a long-term rental company—not a short-term Airbnb operation—so we offer real stability and lasting roles. We value your skills, dedication, and ideas, and treat you as a true teammate, not just labor. If you’re looking for a place to build a long future and truly feel at home, you’ll fit here. 



Testimonial written by Current PH Rep:

"Working with Heavenly Happy Homes over the past year has been an experience I am truly blessed and grateful for. It has indeed been life-changing. From the very beginning, I felt trusted, supported, and encouraged to do my best. That kind of environment makes a huge difference, especially when working remotely. After going through uncertainty in a previous role, I was really praying to find a company where I could grow, learn, and feel secure long-term. Heavenly Happy Homes turned out to be exactly that and more. You genuinely find yourself loving the company and sincerely caring about the work you do. The culture here is respectful and collaborative, and everyone truly wants to see each other succeed. Even as a remote team, there is a strong sense of teamwork and shared purpose, which I honestly love. Training is efficient and well guided. R.S. helped me a lot, especially in understanding processes clearly. Another thing I can sincerely say is that hard work here never goes unnoticed. It is always valued and genuinely appreciated. Our boss, is truly a wonderful employer!"



**How to Apply**

Submit your application here: 

Applications through OLJ may not be considered. Please complete the application at the link in this post.

title: Technical Sales Rep - Construction Products
description:
Our company is an Australian based distributor of insulation & soundproofing related products with 20 years experience. We supply to home owners, builders and other trade professionals throughout Australia.



We currently have a vacancy for another Technical Sales Representative to join our Philippines based virtual team.



Your primary responsibility & duties will include:- 

Reaching out to suitable businesses to uncover sales opportunities for our products, by phone and
.  



Answering inbound phone calls /
s / chat messages and providing product information or sales quotes, and logging information into our CRM software.



Following up on previous quotes or information sent to customers to make a sale.



Skills required:

You will need to have very good English speaking and writing skills, as well as a pleasant clear phone manner.



An understanding of, or ability to quickly learn about construction products like insulation, pipe lagging, soundproofing etc.



The ability to calculate area and use basic mathematics is essential



Sales skills and the ability to close a deal.



An acute attention to details.



Previous experience in an insulation, soundproofing or construction customer service or sales position will be highly regarded



You MUST have:

An excellent internet connection, good computer and head set. ( a back up power supply if you live in power blackout areas)

Ability to use excel spreadsheets, CRM software, phone software etc

Ability to follow instructions clearly.



Work Hours:

8 hours per day, 5 days a week  Monday to Friday. Very early Am starts will necessary due to time zone differences.



Remuneration will be a base of 35,000PHP monthly with commissions of up to 65,000PHP based on sales achieved.



Having good verbal and written English skills is essential. You will be required to attend a virtual interview, followed by a physical interview in Manila  



Training will be provided virtually and in person in Manila



To be considered for the position please reply to 
 with brief details of your previous relative experience. 



Only candidates we deem suitable will be contacted for an interview.



Many thanks. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT – Communications & Outreach (Property Management Company) [REMOTE]
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**

We’re a close, family-like U.S. long-term rental company looking for a sharp, resourceful, people-savvy Executive Assistant to support day-to-day operations. We’re hiring someone with proven, long-term professional experience — in any field. This is NOT an entry-level position.



We’ll train you on the “what” — but we need you to bring the “how.” That means:

**Thinking on your feet

**Solving problems before they escalate

**Speaking English clearly and confidently on the phone

**Caring about the business like it’s your own



We value people who treat the business like they’re part of it — not just clocking hours. If you’re the kind of person who goes the extra mile because you take pride in doing great work, you’ll thrive here.



**WHAT YOU’LL ACTUALLY DO**

• Be a reliable, professional point of contact for current tenants

• Manage lease renewals and ongoing tenant communication

• Make phone calls to gather info, follow up, and resolve issues

• Coordinate tasks, track details, and prevent things from falling through the cracks

• Help solve problems independently — and escalate only when needed

• Keep the owner organized and focused



-> This is not a checklist-following job. It’s a *thinking* role for someone who can move fast, stay calm, and figure things out.



**WHO THIS ROLE IS PERFECT FOR**

• *You speak clearly, confidently, and professionally in English — especially on calls*

• You’re a natural problem solver who can handle unexpected challenges without panic

• You think fast, take initiative, and don’t need hand-holding

• You genuinely care about the quality of your work and the business you’re supporting

• You’re someone who prepares, researches, and shows up ready

• You value long-term stability and being part of a trusted team



-> No property management or sales experience required

-> *Training provided — but success in this role depends on your ability to communicate smoothly and handle live conversations with clarity and confidence*



**WORK SCHEDULE**

This is Remote (Work from Home – must have reliable computer & internet)

• Full-time (40 hours/week) | Independent Contractor

• You choose your exact working hours, but must be reachable and responsive during U.S. Pacific Time business hours (7 AM – 7 PM, Mon–Fri), with active work occurring within that window



**COMPENSATION & GROWTH**

*Base pay up to $800/month to start,* with performance-based increases and bonuses for reliability, initiative, and strong work ethic.

Long-term role with real stability — no short-term rentals, no Airbnb chaos

Direct collaboration with the business owner — your work will actually make a difference



**FROM A CURRENT TEA
MBER**

“Working with Heavenly Happy Homes over the past year has been an experience I am truly blessed and grateful for. It has indeed been life-changing. From the very beginning, I felt trusted, supported, and encouraged to do my best. That kind of environment makes a huge difference, especially when working remotely. After going through uncertainty in a previous role, I was really praying to find a company where I could grow, learn, and feel secure long-term. Heavenly Happy Homes turned out to be exactly that and more. You genuinely find yourself loving the company and sincerely caring about the work you do. The culture here is respectful and collaborative, and everyone truly wants to see each other succeed. Even as a remote team, there is a strong sense of teamwork and shared purpose, which I honestly love. Training is efficient and well guided. R.S. helped me a lot, especially in understanding processes clearly. Another thing I can sincerely say is that hard work here never goes unnoticed. It is always valued and genuinely appreciated. Our boss is truly a wonderful employer!”
