title: Property Sourcing and Follow Up Lead
description:
We're a growing short-term rental business in the US scaling to 20+ properties this year. We're looking for a reliable, organized VA to help find and manage property leads then follow up with people through
 and phone calls. Part time now, with potential for full-time.



They should be a motivated, detail-oriented professional with strong research skills and excellent communication abilities. You'll be responsible for identifying rental properties that fit our housing model, conducting outreach to property owners, and qualifying leads. As our portfolio grows, you'll also support guest communications and operational coordination.



**Main Tasks** 



* Pull rental listings from Zillow, 
,
 Marketplace, Craigslist (50-100+ per week)  

* Analyze market rental rates and qualify leads   

* Respond to property inquiries via messaging platforms,
, and phone calls   

* Follow up with leads using provided templates   

* Track all outreach, responses, and lead status in our system  

* Schedule property viewings  

* Build genuine rapport with through professional, friendly communication



**??What We’re Looking For**



**Required:**



* **Excellent English communication skills** \- both written and spoken, with natural, conversational tone  

* **Ability to build rapport quickly** \- you're personable, warm, and professional (not stiff or robotic)  

* Previous experience with outreach, lead generation, market research, or sales  

* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail  

* Comfortable with Google Sheets/Excel and basic data analysis  

* Self-motivated and able to work independently  

* Can manage multiple tasks and follow through consistently  

* **Can craft personalized messages** outside of the given generic templates



**Preferred (Not Required):**



* Experience with Airbnb, real estate, property management, or corporate housing  

* Familiarity with rental market research  

* Background in customer service or hospitality where building relationships was key  

* Previous cold outreach experience with strong response rates



**You're NOT The Right Fit If:**



* You're uncomfortable having natural phone conversations with strangers  

* You need constant supervision and hand-holding on every task  

* You struggle with organization or tracking multiple conversations  

* You're uncomfortable with outreach or following up persistently  

* You avoid taking initiative when problems arise



**Working Hours**



* Project-based: 15-20 hours per week to start  

* Philippine timezone \- flexible schedule during your working hours  

* Strong potential to become full-time (40+ hours) as we grow to 10-20 properties



**Rate** ?
per hour ($3-5/hour) depending on experience



**How to Apply**



If you're organized, personable, and excited to help build a growing business, we'd love to hear from you.



To apply, kindly fill out this form and send us a message:

title: Creative Strategist / DTC Copywriter (Performance Marketing)
description:
About the job

We are a fast-growing DTC beauty brand built on performance, iteration, and creative excellence. Our growth is driven by testing — and creative is the biggest lever.



We’re hiring a Creative Strategist to own the strategy behind our paid media creatives. This role sits at the intersection of marketing psychology, data, and storytelling, working closely with Editors, Growth, and Media Buying teams to consistently produce winning ad concepts.



This is not a “brand deck” role — it’s about ideas that convert.



What you'll do:



Own the creative strategy for paid media across Meta, TikTok, YouTube, and emerging channels

Develop ad angles, hooks, and messaging frameworks based on data, customer insights, and psychology

Research competitors, trends, and winning creatives to identify scalable opportunities

Write full creative briefs, hooks, scripts, and angles for Video Editors and UGC creators

Collaborate closely with Video Editors to guide execution and iteration

Analyze creative performance (CTR, hold rate, CPA, ROAS) and translate insights into new concepts

Systematize creative testing frameworks and scaling playbooks

Contribute to post-purchase, upsell, and retention creative strategy (AOV & LTV focused)



What were looking for:



2–6+ years of experience in creative strategy for DTC / eCommerce brands

Proven experience building performance-driven ad concepts that scale

Strong understanding of consumer psychology, hooks, and persuasion

Comfortable working closely with data (creative performance metrics, not just opinions)

Experience collaborating with editors, media buyers, and growth teams

Clear communicator who can turn insights into executable creative direction

Fast, iterative mindset — testing > perfection





What we offer:



Fully remote role

Work with a rapidly scaling global beauty brand

Performance-focused environment with real ownership

Clear goals, direct feedback, and room to grow quickly

Competitive salary with performance-based growth

Young, ambitious, international team



Application requirements: 



Please include examples of campaigns, ad concepts, or creatives you’ve contributed to, or briefly explain your role in scaling winning ad creatives. Applications without relevant experience may not be reviewed.

title: Remote Live Chat Sales Agent
description:
Position: Live Chat Sales Agent

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Flexible shifts available days and nights

Hours: Full-time | 8 hours/day, 6–7 days per week

Pay: $3.00/hr starting rate + bonuses and commission (top performers earn up to $6.00/hr)



About the Role

We're looking for a skilled communicator who thrives in fast-paced online conversations. You'll be chatting with real customers on behalf of growing online businesses, building genuine connections, keeping conversations engaging, and converting interest into sales. If you're a natural at written communication and love the challenge of closing deals through chat, this could be the perfect fit.



What You'll Be Doing

You'll manage multiple live chat windows at once (typically 3–8 after training), building rapport with customers while guiding them toward purchases. Using proven scripts and strategies, you'll upsell products and services in a way that feels natural and personal, not pushy. Hitting daily and weekly targets will be a core part of your role, and you'll be expected to follow team guidelines closely at all times.



What We're Looking For



Written English that sounds natural, fluid, and engaging (tested during the hiring process)

Quick, accurate typing skills (also tested)

A genuine sales instinct and confidence in closing

The ability to pick up on tone, mood, and intent through text alone

Reliable internet, a capable laptop, and a quiet place to work

Availability for both day and night shifts

A professional, discreet, and mature approach to work





What's In It For You

We offer weekly payments through Wise or Payoneer, full paid training, and continuous coaching as you grow. There's real earning potential here, your base pay increases as your results improve, and there's no ceiling on what top performers can make. We're looking for people who want to stick around and grow with us long-term.



How to Apply

Send us a short message that includes:



Why you'd be great at sales-based chat work and/or your CV if you have one



Please note: This role demands strong, natural English and genuine conversational ability. If you're not confident in both, we kindly ask that you don't apply. We review every application carefully and will move quickly past anyone who doesn't meet the requirements.

description:

KSHK is a group company providing professional services related to Hong Kong companies, such as auditing, accounting, and taxation under Hong Kong law. We seek an ambitious and career-orientated individual who sees the unique opportunity to grow with the company.



Tasks include:

- Attend to any support issues

title: Customer Support (Written) | No Experience Needed | FUN| Dance Academy
description:
Full-time, long-term opportunity.



Looking for:

- Outstanding English

- Empathy



Our communications with students are FRIENDLY, FUN, and PERSONAL.



ABOUT US

We are the largest salsa & bachata dance academy in Los Angeles and are growing rapidly.



The culture here is FUN, fast, and friendly. Our goal is to make every student feel welcome and completely taken care of.



Dancing changes lives - we are on a mission to deliver the best salsa/bachata educational experience on Earth.



The company is MaS Dance Academy.





ABOUT YOUR TEAM

Working with a remote team that helps with all facets of the business, you'll form a close working relationship and bond with your team mates. We even host team retreats in the Philippines!





SCHEDULE

All times written in PST (Los Angeles time)



TRAINING (2-4 weeks):

Monday-Friday 9am - 6pm (with 1 hour break)



AFTER TRAINING:

Wednesday, Thursday, Friday 1pm-10pm (with 1 hour break)

Saturday, Sunday 9am - 6pm (with 1 hour break)





YOUR ROLE

• Your primary role is written student support (text,
 etc.)

• When there are no support tasks to complete, you'll contribute in a wide variety of other ways, depending on your skills and interests. Some examples may include writing blogs, updating websites, doing research, collecting and analyzing numerical data and using it to create reports, etc.





WRITTEN VS PHONE SUPPORT

• 95% of our student support is written. However, occasionally you will need to be on the phone with a student. You must be comfortable on the phone.





TYPES OF SUPPORT YOU'LL HANDLE

• One on one texting and
ing

• Mass texting and
ing

• Occasional phone calls (rare)

• Updating database after every interaction and attempted interaction

• Daily reports

• Etc.





COMPANY CULTURE

Working in a small business like ours is very different from a large corporation. Some of the differences are:



• Personal tone: Our communications with students are FRIENDLY, FUN, and PERSONAL. It's like talking to your best friend. We use emoji's and exclamation points and are very personal. We take the opposite approach of large corporations that give robotic, frustrating, not very helpful support. You need to be intuitive and have strong emotional intelligence to feel what the students are needing when they communicate.



• More creativity: there is more freedom to adjust your responses for each scenario. This is more challenging than just following strict templates, but also more stimulating and exciting.



• Impact: your actions will have a big impact on the business, which you will clearly see



• Feedback: your feedback on what we are doing well, and what could be better, is not only valued, but is mandatory! We want everyone here thinking as if they were the business owner.





ABOUT YOU

• Perfect written English

• Available full-time

• High emotional intelligence

• Flexible

• Quick learner

• Thrives in fast-paced, quickly changing environment

• Desire to always seek better ways to do things, including finding ways to use A.I. tools

• Happy to be on the phone when needed (which is rarely)

• Tremendous attention to detail - gets things right the first time

• PRO-ACTIVE. Always looking for ways to improve.

• Meticulous, organized, methodical. Almost never misses a detail.

• Critical, creative thinker. Not robotic. Always looking for better ways to do things. Always considering all the angles of a task.

• Not afraid to share your opinion - we NEED to hear your opinion on the approaches that we take so that we can improve.

• Able to ask clarifying questions in order to get tasks right the first time

• Strong communicator

• Makes decisions independently

• Quick learner

• Fast computer

• Fast, dependable Internet

• Bonus if you have experience or interest in salsa or bachata or any dance!





APPLY NOW. FORMAT YOUR APPLICATION AS A NUMBERED LIST WITH THE FOLLOWING:

1. A brief intro about yourself



2. Are you happy to be on the phone when needed?



3. This is a fast-paced environment with quickly changing conditions. You’ll need to be able to think quickly on your feet and track dozens of moving pieces at once with precision and accuracy. This role is NOT for people who feel overly anxious in this type of environment. Apply only if you thrive in such an environment. Based on this information, do you still feel this role is a good fit for you?



4. Complete this form: 
/
. Write in the subject line of your application the answers to the assessment in the link above: 1. Grammar score 2. Typing WPM 3. Numbers assessment answer (regarding achieving $2,000 profit) 4. Highest level of formal education



6. Any customer support experience? If yes, please describe.



7. Any sales experience? (Not required - bonus). If yes, please describe.



8. These positions are competitive, often with hundreds of applicants. What is your competitive requested monthly payment for this full-time position?





(Don't
 us off the platform or message on social media - your application will be disqualified. Don't worry, we personally check every application here)



Looking forward to meeting you!









——————————————

title: Amazon OA Remote Product Sourcing
description:
Job Title: Amazon OA Remote Product Sourcing Expert

________________________________________

Job Description

We're looking for a detail-oriented Online Arbitrage (OA) sourcing expert to join our growing Amazon team full-time. If you have strong sourcing skills, know how to spot profitable leads, and want a role that rewards your results—not just your time—we want to hear from you.

This role is 100% remote and offers performance-based bonuses in addition to a guaranteed hourly rate.

________________________________________

Responsibilities

• Source profitable products to resell on Amazon using OA methods

• Use tools like Keepa, SellerAmp (SAS), and Google Sheets

• Analyze leads based on ROI, profit and Keepa analysis.

• Work your daytime, submit daily leads by 8AM Eastern and respond to feedback to improve

• Stay up to date on Amazon seller policies and trends

________________________________________

Qualifications

• At least 9 months of Amazon OA sourcing experience

• Proficiency with Keepa, SellerAmp (SAS), and similar tools

• Solid understanding of Amazon’s marketplace and terms of service

• Highly detail-oriented and able to follow instructions precisely

• Self-motivated and capable of meeting daily and weekly targets

________________________________________

Work Hours and Schedule

• Full-Time: 40 hours/week (8 hours/day, flexible schedule)

• Long-term role with potential for advancement

________________________________________

Salary & Benefits

• Hourly Rate: $2/hour (guaranteed)

• Monthly Performance Bonus: Starts at $35 for meeting targets; top performers can earn $300+ in bonuses

• Career Growth: Promotion paths to Reviewer, Buyer, or Team Lead

• Weekly Pay + Supportive Feedback Environment

• Initial paid sourcing period: $10 per approved lead (first 3 days)

• Transition to salary after 5 successfully approved leads

________________________________________

How to Apply to be considered.

- A subject line that includes “Sourcing Role 3”

- A short summary of your Amazon OA sourcing experience and tools used



- Confirmation that:

• You understand your performance will be tracked using SellerAmp

• Sharing leads with others will result in immediate termination, reporting to OnlineJobs.ph, and disqualification from future roles

title: Social Media Content Editor & Manager for Anti-Perfection Wellness Brand (Well-ish)
description:
The Brand: 

Well-ish is the antidote to "perfect" wellness culture. We value heritage over aesthetics, flavour over "magic powders," and doing the best we can over 4 AM ice baths. We are rooted in the diaspora and the wisdom of our ancestors.



wellish.co



The Role: 

I am looking for a right-hand creative to take Well-ish from a launch phase to a thriving community. You won’t just be "posting"; you’ll be helping build a movement. Our ethos is wellness for REAL people who love to eat and love the flavours they grew up with. I haven't launched the website yet, but it's built and ready to go. My Instagram and TikTok presence is CRUCIAL to growing my brand and my own profile as in "influencer" in the wellness space. I need someone with impeccable taste, excellent aesthetics, great humour and wit who can understand the brand's voice and create authentic content to really build our presence and influence on socials. Ideally, you'll have experience crafting influencer strategies and organically growing audiences.



Key Responsibilities:



Content Creation: Transform raw footage/photos (fro
) into high-end, editorial Reels, Stories, and Posts on TikTok and Instagram (~5x per week).



Social Management: Manage the grid, write witty/grounded captions, and engage with the community on Instagram and TikTok.



Web &
: Light editing on our Squarespace site (posting recipes and content), and managing our
 newsletter (sharing recipes, tips, and updates).



Brand Voice: Protect the "Well-ish" philosophy. No generic AI tips; keep it literal, real, and soulful.



The Ideal Candidate:



-The Vibe: You understand the "Well-ish" definition and ethos: The sweet spot between where we are and where we’re going. You probably roll your eyes at wellness influencers in Lululemon drinking matcha and taking cold plunges.



-Tech Savvy: Proficient in CapCut/Canva,
 platforms (Mailchimp), and basic web editing. You LOVE AI or have a strong curiosity for how to apply this to your work.

Compensation and hours will start at $4/hr for 5–10 hours per week. This will likely increase to 20–30+ hours per week over the next few months based on performance and availability. Experience with graphic design



What you will do in this role:

My goal is to build you up over time: clearer thinking, better writing, stronger product instincts, and more ownership. If you perform well, hours and pay increase with responsibility.

Opportunities for Growth

title: AI Integration Engineer
description:
AI Integration Engineer (Remote)



You’ll first build and deploy AI workflows for Asterley Bros, an SME based in London, manufacturing alcoholic drinks and cocktails. 

LLMs will generate much of the boilerplate code and agent configurations; your job is to architect solutions, integrate them safely into real systems, and make sure they’re secure, reliable, and easy for non technical users.

What you’ll do

• Map real workflows (operations, customer support, sales, marketing).

• Design and implement AI agents and automations using OpenClaw/LLM APIs.

• Review and harden LLM generated code (security, error handling, maintainability).

• Integrate with tools like
, ecommerce, spreadsheets, CRM, and internal docs.

• Set up monitoring, logging, and simple dashboards the team can actually use.

What we’re looking for

• Strong Python for APIs/scripting (JavaScript/TypeScript is a plus).

• Solid experience building/consuming REST APIs and handling auth, errors, retries.

• Comfort with SQL and basic cloud deployment (e.g. Docker + a major cloud).

• Hands on experience with LLM APIs (e.g. Claude/GPT/Gemini) and prompt design.

• Familiarity with agent frameworks (OpenClaw or similar) and how to constrain/monitor agents.

• Security mindset: input validation, secret handling, basic understanding of data privacy.

• Great communication with non technical people and a product mindset: you enjoy making tools that actually get used.

Role details

• Location: Fully remote 

• Type: Full time / Part-time depending on availability. Flexible for the right candidate

• Hours: Must be able to overlap with UK working hours for part of the day.

• Compensation: Competitive for PH market, with performance based upside as the company grows.

If you’re excited about using AI agents to solve real problems for real businesses, send your CV, GitHub/portfolio, and a short note describing one automation or integration you’re proud of.

We ARE looking for:

This leadership-focused role includes coordinating daily operations, assisting with recruiting and hiring, communicating with clients and tea
mbers via phone/SMS/email, negotiating when needed to up-charge clients when conditions differ from booking details or add-ons arise, providing discounts or service recovery solutions when cleaners are late or no-shows, coordinating backup cleaners, resolving access issues throughout the day, supporting creative social media growth, identifying operational gaps, and helping build stronger systems and workflows (AI/automation experience is a strong plus).

Competitive pay, bonuses, PTO after proven consistency, and growth opportunities every 6 months for strong performers. Do not apply if you struggle with accountability, organization, or fast-paced environments. BONUS: There will be incentive pay for turning clients into recurring subscription model cleanings and additional incentives for obtaining 5-star reviews. No commission cap!



DISC: You should be a High D and High C for this role. Please provide DISC test results (if available).

title: Business Outreach & Client Research Specialist (US Businesses)
description:
Business Outreach & Client Research Specialist (US Businesses)

Rate: $8/hour | Long-Term Remote Role



About Us

We are a U.S.-based company that works with service businesses across the United States such as cleaning companies, HVAC companies, plumbers, electricians, pest control companies, and other local service providers.



Many of these businesses are growing quickly and are hiring office staff to keep up with scheduling, customer communication, and daily operations.



Our team studies how these companies operate so we can better support them.

We are looking for someone who is comfortable speaking with business owners, asking thoughtful questions, and documenting what they share.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Researching service businesses in the United States

• Reaching out to business owners by phone or message

• Asking a few structured questions about how their operations work

• Listening carefully and documenting information clearly

• Identifying businesses that may want to learn more about our services

• Sharing insights with our internal team



You will follow a simple outreach framework that we provide.



This role involves real conversations with real business owners.



Communication Expectations

You will regularly speak with business owners in the United States.

You should be comfortable:

• Starting conversations with people you haven’t met before

• Asking questions and guiding a short discussion

• Listening carefully and responding naturally

• Keeping conversations calm and professional

• Handling occasional rejection without getting discouraged

Strong spoken English is important for this role.



Who This Role Is Best For

People with experience in:

• business outreach

• lead research

• appointment setting

• market research

• customer-facing virtual assistant roles

• client communication

• business development support



If you enjoy understanding how businesses operate and speaking with decision makers, you will likely do well here.



Important Traits

We’re looking for someone who is:

• Comfortable speaking with strangers

• Curious about how businesses run

• Organized with notes and follow-up

• Consistent and reliable

• Calm and professional on calls

• Self-motivated



This is not a passive admin role.

You will be actively communicating with businesses.



Typical Day

Your day may include:

• researching businesses

• starting conversations with owners

• asking questions about their operations

• documenting responses

• identifying businesses that want more information

• sharing feedback with our team



Equipment Requirements

• Reliable internet connection

• Quiet work environment

• Computer capable of running web applications

• Headset or microphone for clear calls



Opportunity

People who perform well in this role often take on larger responsibilities within our team, including roles that involve deeper client interaction and business growth.



Application Questions(Required)

Please answer the following when applying:



Are you comfortable speaking with business owners in the United States?

Have you worked in outreach, appointment setting, or client communication before?

How many phone conversations per day are you comfortable starting?

Tell us about a time you had to ask questions to understand a business problem.

Why do you think you would be a good fit for this role?



Final Step(Required)

Please include a short voice recording (30–60 seconds) answering this question:

“If you called a business owner who was busy, how would you start the conversation?”



This helps us understand communication style.

title: Multifamily Analyst
description:
About Avita



OTH Capital / Avita Property Management is a tech-enabled, data-driven multifamily platform managing ~5,000+ units across Texas and ~$800M in asset value.



We operate with an ownership mentality — focused on NOI growth, operational accountability, and institutional-grade reporting. We are building a centralized analytics team to support portfolio-level decision-making as we scale.



Role Overview



The Multifamily Analyst will support executive leadership, asset management, and operations by providing real-time analytics, financial modeling, and performance insights across the portfolio.



This role goes beyond reporting — it drives strategic decisions around:



Revenue optimization



Budget performance



Occupancy stabilization



Delinquency control



Market positioning



You will work directly with U.S.-based Regional Managers and Executive Leadership.



Core Responsibilities

Revenue & Occupancy Analytics

Analyze leasing velocity, renewal trends, concessions

Monitor occupancy vs. pro forma and budget

Support pricing recommendations

Track net effective rent trends



Financial & Budget Analysis

Prepare monthly budget vs. actual variance reports

Identify expense anomalies and revenue leakage

Support annual budgeting process

Assist with cash flow forecasting



Delinquency & Risk Monitoring

Track portfolio-wide delinquency

Analyze collections performance

Support structured collections strategy

Flag operational risks early



Market Intelligence

Perform submarket comp analysis (Texas focus)

Monitor new supply deliveries

Track rent growth trends



Executive Reporting

Build weekly KPI dashboards

Prepare monthly portfolio summary for leadership

Support board-level reporting

Maintain standardized data models



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related

3–6 years analytical experience

Advanced Excel (required)

Strong written English



Experience supporting U.S. clients preferred



Real estate / multifamily exposure strongly preferred



Compensation

$8–10 USD per hour (based on experience)

Performance bonus eligibility (quarterly)



30–60–90 Day Performance Roadmap

This is critical for scaling with intention.



First 30 Days – Understand & Build Foundations



Goal: Learn Avita’s operating model and data stack.

Review portfolio P&Ls and KPIs

Understand rent roll structure

Learn delinquency reporting format

Shadow Regional Manager meetings

Audit current reporting templates

Identify inconsistencies in data tracking



Deliverable:

Cleaned KPI master dashboard (baseline version)

1-page performance summary template



Day 31–60 – Analyze & Improve

Goal: Move from reporting ? insight.

Identify top 5 revenue leakage areas



Highlight delinquency outliers

Provide first renewal strategy analysis

Create variance analysis tracker

Standardize weekly revenue reporting



Deliverable:

Executive-ready Weekly Portfolio Performance Report

Revenue improvement action memo



Day 61–90 – Drive Strategy

Goal: Become a strategic contributor.

Build 6-month occupancy forecast model

Recommend pricing or concession adjustments



Identify underperforming assets

Propose KPI thresholds for early warning system

Support budget assumptions modeling



Deliverable:

Forward-looking Portfolio Forecast Model

Quarterly Revenue Strategy Presentation

By Day 90, this person should:

Be influencing decision-making

Flagging issues before they escalate



Operating independently

KPI Scorecard for Multifamily Analyst

This is how you hold them accountable.



Revenue Performance Metrics

Occupancy % vs Budget

Net Effective Rent Growth

Renewal Rate %

Concession % of GPR

Delinquency Metrics

Delinquency % of GPR



30/60/90-day aging trend

Bad debt write-offs trend

Financial Accuracy Metrics

Budget variance accuracy

Forecast accuracy (within 3–5%)

Timeliness of weekly reports

Data error rate

title: Distressed Property Specialist (U.S. Accent Only)
description:
Note: This is NOT a VA job. Apply ONLY if you have strong ASSET RECOVERY experience.

This is NOT cold calling.

This is NOT boiler-room sales.

This is NOT pressure-based scripting.

This is high-level, consultative work with families who need clarity, empathy, and a strong communicator who can guide them.





Are you exceptional at talking to people in difficult situations?

Have you worked in collections, recovery, or loss mitigation?

Can you stay calm when someone is emotional, frustrated, or overwhelmed?

Do you have a clear U.S. or U.S-neutral accent and the ability to connect quickly?



If yes — this is the best career move you will ever make.



We are a real estate investment company that works with:



families handling a deceased loved one’s property

heirs who inherited land or homes with complications

owners who are behind on taxes or mortgage

siblings who can’t agree on what to do with a property

families trying to avoid foreclosure

people dealing with probate, title issues, or liens



Your job is to help these families find a solution, earn their trust, and guide them through a clean, fair transaction.



YOUR ROLE (WHAT YOU WILL ACTUALLY DO)

1. Speak with heirs, relatives, and decision-makers



deceased owner situations

no probate filed

3–7 heirs with conflicting opinions

tax foreclosure deadlines

mortgage default

family disagreements

emotional conversations



This requires emotional intelligence and patience.



2. Build trust FAST



Good people trust you because you sound calm, professional, and transparent.



You will not sound like a wholesaler or telemarketer.

You will sound like a solution provider.



3. Offer realistic, helpful options



You will help them understand choices like:



buying out their share

paying taxes to save time

helping with probate

delaying foreclosure

purchasing fractional interests

resolving family disagreements

You are a guide, not a salesperson.



4. Negotiate respectfully and intelligently



You must know how to:



de-escalate tension

uncover motivations

negotiate price & terms

coordinate multiple heirs

communicate step-by-step

keep the process moving without pressure



5. Follow up like a professional



Deals often happen:



after the 3rd–7th conversation

when a sibling changes their mind

when someone finally picks up

when emotions settle

You must track your pipeline and follow up consistently.



WHO WILL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE (OUR IDEAL MATCH)



We want someone who has succeeded in roles like:



Senior Recovery Specialist

Asset Recovery Specialist

Debt Collections Specialist

Loss Mitigation Specialist

Delinquent Account Negotiator

Foreclosure Outreach Agent

Mortgage Hardship Counselor

Auto Repossession Negotiator

Medical Bill Settlement Specialist



If you’ve handled:



a) emotional people

b) people behind on payments

c) delinquent accounts

d) bankruptcy or loss situations

e) high-friction conversations

f) families under pressure

g) financial stress cases



…you will excel here.



You understand:



psychology

money pressure

family conflict

urgency

decision-making under stress



This is EXACTLY what our sellers face.



REQUIREMENTS (STRICT)



MUST HAVE:



Clear U.S. or U.S-Southern accent

Minimum 3 years in recovery, collections, or hardship negotiations

Excellent conversational control

Ability to stay calm with emotional sellers

Strong problem-solving ability

Excellent note-taking and follow-up discipline

Ability to understand simple legal concepts

Quiet work environment & reliable internet



PREFERRED:



Experience with heirs, probate, foreclosure, or title issues

Experience coordinating multiple decision-makers

Real estate or legal background

High empathy & strong emotional intelligence



NOT ACCEPTED (0% consideration):



noticeable foreign accents

cold-calling experience only

“scripted telemarketer” style

BPO boiler-room callers

anyone who sounds like a wholesaler

people who pressure, push, or rush sellers

VAs with no negotiation background



COMPENSATION & STRUCTURE



Competitive hourly pay (based on experience)

Performance bonuses per signed agreement

Long-term, stable role

Daily script guidance + coaching

Work hours: 11:30 AM to 8:00 PM US EST

Small, professional team

High-quality leads provided daily

Support from genealogist, researcher, and title abstractor

This is a career, not a calling gig.



TO APPLY



Required — Applications without these will be ignored:



A 30–60 second voice recording introducing yourself

Explanation of your recovery/collections experience

A real example of a difficult conversation you handled

Your availability (days & time zone)

Expected hourly rate

title: BreakBites Support (VA) – Parlevel (VMS) + Spreadsheets + Customer Support
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

BreakBites is a vending and micro market business in the U.S. We are hiring a Virtual Assistant for our **BreakBites Support** role. This is a process-based position focused on supporting operations through our VMS (Parlevel), spreadsheets, customer support, and documentation. You will follow SOPs, route customers into our existing forms and processes, keep our systems organized and accurate, and help us continuously improve our workflows.



This role requires someone who is a **fast learner**, detail-oriented, and consistent.



---



## CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



### 1) Parlevel (VMS Dashboard) – Primary



You will primarily use the **Parlevel web dashboard** (mobile app may be used occasionally). Tasks include:



* Pull **sales reports** by location/machine

* Pull **product performance** reports (what sells, what does not)

* Flag **machine issues** and patterns (errors, card reader issues, bill validator issues, outages, recurring problems)

* Update and maintain **route notes** / service notes by location

* Build or export **restock lists** and operational reports as needed

* Help identify trends and issues that affect inventory accuracy and customer experience



### 2) Spreadsheets + Documentation (Excel/Word)



* Update trackers in **Excel** (inventory notes, product lists, location notes, expiration lead times)

* Track and maintain estimated **expiration lead times** by product

* Log and organize recurring issues (barcode problems, scan issues, price mismatch notes)

* Keep files organized in a clean folder structure and follow naming rules



### 3) Customer Support (Calls, Texts,
)



You will handle incoming customer communication and route customers through our process.



* Respond to calls/texts/emails professionally as BreakBites Support

* Direct customers to the correct **refund/issue form** whenever possible

* If no form exists for the situation, collect the key details and log the issue

* You are **not** responsible for issuing cash refunds or coupon codes unless explicitly approved

* If you do not know the answer, use this approach: **“Let me confirm with my supervisor and get back to you.”**



### 4) Connecteam Support (Light Oversight)



* Review Connecteam updates and ensure employees are where they should be (GPS/check-ins as needed)

* Review basic team posts and operational updates

* Assist with ensuring training videos/tasks (like stocking/sorting content) are being followed

  (This is a smaller part of the role compared to Parlevel and admin work.)



### 5) Minor Video Editing



* Perform simple edits like trimming clips, removing dead time, basic organizing/exports, and preparing videos for upload

* Follow naming rules and upload videos to the correct folders (Google Drive or other storage we use)



### 6) SOP Creation and Updates



* Create and update SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) based on our workflows

* Convert processes into clear step-by-step checklists that a tea
mber can follow independently

* Keep SOPs organized and formatted consistently (Word/Google Docs)



---



## WORK SCHEDULE



* **Part-time:** 15–20 hours/week

* **Workdays:** Monday–Friday

* **Availability:** Preferred within **8:00 AM–5:00 PM CST**



---



## TOOLS YOU WILL USE



* Parlevel (VMS)

* Excel + Word

* Gmail

* Connecteam

* ChatGPT



---



## MUST HAVE



* Fast learner

* Strong attention to detail

* Comfortable with dashboards and spreadsheets

* Strong written English and clear communication

* Reliable internet + dependable work habits

* Can follow SOPs and processes without constant supervision

title: Community Growth + Content VA (Facebook Group ? Circle)
description:
JOB SUMMARY: 

I’m looking for a reliable VA to run content and community operations for Generational Gamechangers (GGC). Your job is to keep the
 group active, consistently funnel members into our Circle private community, and publish educational content inside Circle based on our pillars. Over time, you’ll also help build 4 pillar learning tracks inside Circle that function like mini-courses (modules, actions, templates).



This is not a “post quotes” role. I need an executor who can write clearly, follow a cadence, engage consistently, and improve based on feedback.



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE


 group stays active and conversational (comments, replies, members welcomed)

-More people join Circle each week from the
 group

-Circle content is educational, organized, and consistent

-Pillar tracks get built over time into structured learning paths



RESPONSIBILITIES

A)
 Group: Content + Engagement + Funnel to Circle

 -Create and post 3–5
 posts per week

 -Daily engagement: reply to comments, tag members, welcome new members, spark conversations

 -Create 1 weekly “bridge post” designed to funnel people into Circle

 -Use simple conversion CTAs like: “Comment CIRCLE and I’ll send the link” (or similar)

 -Keep the pinned post + welcome message updated (we will provide link + details)



B) Circle Community: Educational Content + Engagement

 -Create and publish 3 educational posts per week based on our pillars

 -Post 1 resource per week (checklist, worksheet, template, or framework)

 -Post 1 weekly recap + next steps

 -Engage daily inside Circle: respond, ask follow-up questions, keep threads moving



C) Build the 4 Pillar Learning Tracks (Course-Style)

 -Over time, you will help develop 4 structured learning tracks inside Circle.

 -Create track outlines (module titles + outcomes)

 -Draft module lessons (short, clear, actionable)

 -Add action steps, prompts, and simple downloadable templates

 -Keep everything organized in a tracker (Google Sheet or Notion)



REQUIRED SKILLS

-Strong written English (clear, natural, not robotic)

-Can write educational content that is easy to understand and apply

-Knows how to increase engagement in communities (not just posting and disappearing)

-Organized and consistent (trackers, deadlines, weekly planning)

-Canva skills for simple clean visuals (not complex design)



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)

-Experience managing
 groups/pages

-Circle experience

-CapCut/Reels editing

-Basic instructional design / course building experience



HOURS / SCHEDULE

-Start part-time: 15 hours/week

-Opportunity to expand to 20+ hours/week based on performance

-Daily engagement required (Mon–Fri minimum)



LONG-TERM OPPORTUNITY

I’m not hiring for a one-off VA. I’m hiring someone I can build with. I run multiple businesses and I consistently expand responsibility and pay for people who execute, communicate well, and improve fast. If you deliver strong results over time, this can turn into a higher-paid, expanded role across multiple companies. If you’re the right person, I’m open to investing in your growth through training and expanded responsibilities. Trust, quality, and execution matter here.



TO APPLY (FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS)

Subject line: GGC VA – [Your Name]

Include:

-Your hourly rate

-2–3 writing samples (links or screenshots of posts/lessons you wrote)



Answers (short + specific):

-What communities have you managed?

-How would you funnel
 group members into a private Circle community without being spammy?

-What tools do you use to plan/schedule content?



MINI-TEST (REQUIRED)

Start your application with this line:

“I understand the goal is
 Group ? Circle conversion + pillar-based education inside Circle.”

Then complete all of the following:

A) Write ONE
 group post that drives comments and funnels to Circle (include the CTA “Comment CIRCLE…”).

B) Write ONE Circle educational post on Personal Development (short lesson + 5 action steps + 1 discussion question).

C) Create a 6-module outline for a Real Estate Investing track (module titles only).



Confirm:

-You can commit 15 hours/week

-You’re okay with content approvals at first, with the goal of earning full trust over time

-You can use Canva + a tracker (Google Sheet or Notion)

-Applications that do not follow instructions will be ignored.



PAY NOTE 

 -Pay is based on experience and skill. Raises are performance-based and tied to execution, consistency, engagement quality, and conversion into Circle.

title: Motion Designer
description:
I am a Doctor of Physical Therapy building a long-form YouTube series for combat athletes (MMA, Muay Thai, Boxing).

This is an editorial, documentary-style breakdown show focused on:

• Fight camp decision-making

• Performance and readiness

• Injury prevention in fighter language

• Calm, intelligent analysis

The fighter is the emotional center.

I appear occasionally as a steady analyst voice — not a cartoon host.

This is a long-term role.

???? Responsibilities

• Animate 1 × 8–10 minute YouTube episode per week

• Help establish a consistent visual template (intro, lower thirds, transitions)

• Create minimal line-art or clean illustrated figures

• Animate cinematic fight-training sequences (minimal but dynamic)

• Use AI voiceover tools when needed (ElevenLabs, etc.)

• Deliver clean exports and timestamps for social clips

Expected commitment:

15–25 hours per week

 Style Direction

Think:

• Vice / Complex / sports documentary tone

• Minimal, mature design

• Clean line art or simplified illustration

• Dark editorial aesthetic

• Subtle motion

• Strong typography

• Negative space

This is not explainer-style animation.

This is not children’s educational content.

It should feel composed, confident, and restrained.

???? Requirements

• Strong motion design skills (After Effects preferred)

• Comfortable using AI tools (voiceovers, generative visuals where appropriate)

• Good sense of pacing and storytelling

• Able to build reusable templates

• Strong communication

• Portfolio required



Long-term position

CONCEPT TEST To move forward, please complete the following short concept test (45 seconds max).

This is not a full production.

I am evaluating style, pacing, and tone.

Concept Prompt

Animate a 30–45 second sequence based on this script:

Five rounds in.

Sparring’s getting messy.

His jab’s a half-beat late.

He keeps blaming his footwork.

But it’s not his feet.

His reactions are slow.

His guard drops a second too long.

This isn’t toughness.

This is fatigue pretending to be discipline.

And this is where most fighters lose the fight before they ever step in the cage.

title: Kommo CRM Automation Specialist (Salesbot & AI Focus)
description:
Kommo CRM Automation Specialist (Salesbot & AI Focus)

(This is a role for an expert, not someone still learning)



Overview

I Go Panama is a virtual, bilingual (English/Spanish) team of five based in Panama. We use a single Kommo Advanced seat to manage high-volume inquiries from tourists and businesses. We are looking for an independent consultant (not an agency) to help us automate our lead triage and engagement using Salesbots and AI.



The Project Scope

We have a fixed initial budget of $500. We are looking for the maximum "basics" setup possible within this budget, focused on our five existing pipelines. Our goal is to reduce manual triage and ensure high-value leads reach our salesperson quickly.



Technical Environment:

Channels: FB, IG, TikTok,
, and 2x WhatsApp Lite numbers.

Current State: Pipelines are built; customers are imported; basic templates are in use.

Immediate Need: Salesbot logic to automate "Education & Encouragement" flows and lead movement.



Priority & Logic Requirements

We have ranked our needs by priority. Please specify how many of these flows you can build within the $500 budget:



Priority 1: INDIVIDUALS (High Volume Triage)

Goal: Automate "Education & Encouragement" via bot.

Logic: Provide a "Free Join" link for our directory. If no interaction occurs within 10 days, auto-delete the lead to keep the CRM clean.



Priority 2: HOTELS (High Revenue)

Goal: Dedicated bot flow for hotel-specific arguments/packages.

Logic: Qualify and immediately notify/push to our salesperson for 1-on-1 interaction.



Priority 3: CUSTOMERS (Onboarding)

Goal: Post-signup care.

Logic: Trigger educational drips and upsell prompts for additional marketing services once a lead is moved to this stage.



Priority 4: BUSINESSES

Goal: Similar to Hotels, but for service providers (Relocation, Legal, etc.).

Logic: Bot-led qualification and hand-off to sales.



Priority 5: COMMUNITY ORGANIZERS

Goal: Long-term nurturing.

Logic: Re-engagement drip every few weeks for non-conversions.



Consultant Requirements

No Agency Upselling: We are not looking for a "digital transformation" partner or a $5k implementation. We need a technical builder who respects the $500 starter budget.

Bilingual Capability: Must be comfortable working in English or Spanish.

Technical Fit: You must have specific experience with Kommo Salesbots and AI triggers.

Timeline: We intend to select a partner within 48 hours and complete the initial setup within 7–10 days.



How to Apply



Please respond with:



A brief summary of a similar Kommo automation project you’ve completed.



A specific breakdown of which priorities (1 through 5) you can realistically deliver for the $500 budget.

Your availability to start this week.



You may apply directly here, or you can

mbers.

title: Design Operations Coordinator (Canva + Shopify) , Fashion
description:
About Us

We are a fast-growing luxury uniform and lifestyle brand serving leading hospitality and wellness clients globally. Our brand is built on quiet luxury, elevated design, and exceptional client experience. We’re looking for a creative professional who can not only design beautiful materials, but also bring structure and organization to our entire design ecosystem.



Role Overview

We’re hiring a Philippines-based Creative Designer who is highly skilled in Canva and Shopify and can also own and manage our design organization and workflows.



This role works directly with the Founder and Product Development team to:

Create compelling, client-ready presentations

Maintain a highly organized system for all design assets

Ensure smooth communication between design, product development, and manufacturing

This is a mix of creative design + operational ownership — ideal for someone who is both artistic and highly organized.



Key Responsibilities

1) Canva & Client Presentations (Primary Creative Work)

Translate client vision and Founder direction into luxury, client-ready Canva presentations

Create:

Uniform design proposals

Lookbooks

Mood boards

Color stories and fabric concepts

Sales presentations

Maintain a clean, elevated aesthetic aligned with a luxury fashion brand

Execute revisions quickly and accurately

2) Design Organization & Asset Management (Critical Ownership Area)

You will own and manage our entire design library.

Organize and maintain:

Design files

Pattern files

Tech packs

Fabric and trim references

Client-specific folders

Final approved versions

Create and maintain a clear folder structure and naming system

Ensure the team is always working from the latest approved files

Keep everything streamlined, easy to find, and audit-ready

Support version control and archive outdated materials

3) Cross-Team Communication

Work closely with the Founder on creative direction

Coordinate with the Product Development team

Share organized files with manufacturing vendors when needed

Ensure vendors receive accurate, complete, and clearly labeled materials

Follow up to confirm files and revisions are understood

4) Shopify (Website Support)

Build and update pages on Shopify

Upload products, images, and collections

Maintain a polished, premium website experience

Support landing pages for launches or client initiatives

5) Social Media (As Needed)

Create branded graphics for Instagram and LinkedIn

Support marketing campaigns while maintaining the brand’s luxury aesthetic

Requirements

Must-Have

Advanced Canva experience (required)

Experience with Shopify

Strong organizational and file management skills

Experience managing design assets, tech packs, or product files

Understanding of luxury fashion or premium branding

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Strong written English and communication skills

Comfortable working remotely and collaborating across time zones

Nice to Have

Experience in fashion, uniforms, or apparel production

Familiarity with tech packs, patterns, or manufacturing workflows

Experience working with international teams or vendors

Who You Are

You have a clean, elevated design aesthetic (quiet luxury)

You’re both creative and highly organized

You take ownership and create structure, not chaos

You move fast, communicate clearly, and think ahead

You’re comfortable working closely with a Founder in a growing company

Position Details

Remote (Philippines-based)

Part-time or Full-time (depending on experience)

Long-term role with growth potential



To Apply, Please include:

Portfolio (Canva presentations required)

Shopify examples (links)

Examples of any organized design systems, tech packs, or file management work (if available)

Candidates who do not share portfolio examples will not be considered

title: eBay Listing Specialist (Retail Arbitrage | High Volume)
description:
eBay Listing Specialist (Retail Arbitrage | High Volume)



We are a US-based eCommerce seller looking for a reliable and detail-oriented eBay Listing Specialist.



We sell brand new retail products and are scaling aggressively. We need someone who understands Sold Listings, pricing strategy, and can list high volumes accurately.



This is a long-term opportunity.



Responsibilities:



Create eBay listings using product information we provide



Search product using barcode or image



Filter by Sold Listings to determine pricing



Calculate price including shipping and fees



Write SEO titles if exact listing does not exist



Use “Sell Similar” when appropriate



Fill out item specifics correctly and completely



Update expiration dates if applicable



Upload photos from Google Drive



Revise listings weekly if unsold



Requirements:



Minimum 1 year experience listing on US eBay accounts (REQUIRED)



Strong understanding of Sold vs Active listings



Comfortable doing pricing math



High attention to detail (no pricing or shipping mistakes)



Able to complete 40–70 listings per day accurately



Stable internet connection



Good written English



Compensation:



$3–$4/hour depending on experience



20 hours per week trial (2 weeks)



Opportunity to move to full-time (40 hours/week)



Bi-weekly payment



Long-term role with growth potential



To Apply, Answer the Following:



What experience do you have listing on eBay?



Describe step-by-step how you use Sold Listings to determine pricing.



What is the difference between Active listings and Sold listings?



If the average sold price for an item you want to list is $29.99 with free shipping, 

and our store is running 20% off all products, and our shipping cost is $8.29 flat rate, how would you calculate the correct listing price so it is a 1-3 dollars cheaper? Show your math.



How many listings can you complete per day accurately?



Type the word PROFIT at the top of your application.

title: Guest Experience Manager
description:
>

About the Role:



We are looking for a dedicated, customer-centric Guest Experience Manager to become the first point of contact for guests booking tables at our restaurants and pubs. In this role, you will ensure every guest receives a warm welcome from the 
nt they enquire, supporting them throughout their booking journey and enhancing their overall dining experience.

You will handle inbound reservation calls, manage
 communication, secure deposits, and coordinate closely with our on-site restaurant management teams—particularly for large groups and special bookings. Your goal is to deliver a smooth, professional, and memorable guest experience from start to finish.



Key Responsibilities:



Guest Communication & Support

- Respond to guest enquiries via
 with clear, well-written communication.

Reservation Management

- Follow all booking procedures consistently and correctly every time.

- Manage amendments, cancellations, and special requests with attention to detail.

Coordination & Collaboration

Why Join Us?

title: CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist (GoHighLevel + Content Support)
description:
About Us:



We are a nurse-owned hospice company in Arizona focused on compassionate care, strong community relationships, and growth through systems and education. We are building a structured CRM inside GoHighLevel to track referrals, automate follow-ups, and strengthen referral partner relationships.



We are also building a video and podcast presence to educate the community and drive traffic to our website and YouTube channel.



We are looking for a long-term team member who can grow with us.



Phase 1: CRM Build-Out (Immediate Focus)



Your first priority will be to:



• Set up GoHighLevel CRM from scratch

• Build 3 main pipelines (Referral Intake, Referral Partner, Bereavement)

• Import and organize contacts

• Tag contacts correctly

• Create task templates the owner can assign quickly

• Build automation workflows (SMS +
 follow-ups)

• Connect website forms to CRM

• Ensure clean structure and reporting

• Document simple SOPs



We are building:

• Referral tracking system

• Google lead response automation

• Drip campaigns for referral partners

• Bereavement follow-up sequence



Phase 2: Content & Brand Growth Support (Long-Term)



Once CRM is structured and running smoothly, your responsibilities will expand to:



• Edit short-form video clips (Reels, TikTok, Shorts)

• Edit 30-minute mini podcast episodes

• Add captions and subtitles

• Create SEO-optimized titles and descriptions

• Upload and schedule content across platforms

• Optimize YouTube metadata

• Repurpose long-form content into short clips

• Help drive traffic back to our website



Required Skills:



• GoHighLevel experience (must explain what you’ve built)

• CRM workflow creation

• Marketing automation logic

• Tagging & segmentation strategy

• Strong written English

• Basic video editing (CapCut, Descript, Premiere, etc.)

• Understanding of SEO for YouTube and social media



Ideal Candidate:



• Thinks in systems, not just tasks

• Organized and detail-oriented

• Can suggest improvements

• Understands marketing funnels

• Comfortable with automation tools

• Interested in long-term growth



Hours & Compensation:



• 15–20 hours per week to start

• Potential long-term growth

• Flexible schedule

• Please include hourly rate



To Apply:



Please answer:



Describe a CRM you have built from scratch.



What automations have you created in GoHighLevel?



How would you structure a referral pipeline for a healthcare business?



What video editing tools do you use?



Explain how you optimize YouTube titles and descriptions for SEO.



Include the word “Engine” at the top of your application.

title: Architectural Designer with Revit + AutoCAD + Permit Experience
description:
JOB TITLE

Architectural Designer with Revit + AutoCAD + Permit Experience (Rockland County Projects)



JOB CATEGORY

Engineering / Architecture / Drafting



JOB TYPE

Full Time or Contract



COMPENSATION

Based on experience and portfolio quality. Long-term opportunity for high performers.



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are hiring an Architectural Designer who can independently produce full permit-ready drawing sets for residential and light commercial projects. The ideal candidate has real experience preparing construction documents that pass municipal plan review. Experience with New York or US building code is strongly preferred.



This is not a beginner drafting role. We are looking for someone who understands construction drawings, zoning compliance, and permit submission requirements.



RESPONSIBILITIES

Prepare full permit drawing packages from concept through submission

Draft plans using Revit or AutoCAD

Prepare site plans, floor plans, elevations, sections, and details

Coordinate structural drawings with licensed engineers

Revise drawings based on plan review comments

Prepare organized permit submission packages

Create interior and exterior renderings when needed

Verify code compliance and zoning requirements

Communicate clearly and professionally with project manager



REQUIRED SKILLS

Revit or AutoCAD proficiency

Construction document production experience

Understanding of building codes and zoning rules

Ability to prepare full drawing sets independently

Strong attention to detail

Ability to follow instructions precisely

Reliable internet and workstation capable of running design software



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

US permitting experience

Residential or commercial construction drawings

Working with engineers and consultants

Rendering software such as Lumion, Enscape, or V-Ray



IMPORTANT

Applicants without real construction document experience will not be considered.



SCREENING INSTRUCTIONS (REQUIRED)

To apply, you must
 the following:



1. Portfolio showing at least 3 full drawing sets





2. Resume or CV





3. Software list you are proficient in





4. Internet speed test screenshot





5. Answer this question in your
 subject line:

What is the standard minimum ceiling height for residential spaces?







Applications missing any requirement will be automatically rejected.



SEND APPLICATIONS TO







---



RECOMMENDED SKILL TAGS FOR ONLINEJOBS.PH

Revit

-Experience with CRM systems (preferred but not required)

-Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

-Availability during U.S. business hours

"Hi, thank you for calling Bounce N Bash, this is [Your Name]. How can I help you today? Can you tell me a little about the type of event you're hosting and how many guests you’re expecting? Based on that, I can recommend some of our most popular rental packages to make your event stress-free and memorable.”

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
We are seeking an experienced and strategic Senior SEO Specialist to lead and scale our organic growth initiatives. This role is ideal for someone who not only understands SEO at a deep technical level but can also translate strategy into measurable business results.



If you think beyond rankings, understand search intent across the full customer journey, and know how to turn organic visibility into sustainable revenue growth — we want to hear from you.



As a Senior SEO Specialist, you will take ownership of our SEO strategy, oversee execution, and drive continuous optimization across technical, on-page, and content initiatives.



Key Responsibilities:



Develop and lead comprehensive SEO strategies aligned with business and revenue goals

Conduct advanced keyword research, search intent analysis, and competitive benchmarking

Perform in-depth technical SEO audits and oversee implementation (site architecture, crawl optimization, indexing, Core Web Vitals, structured data)

Drive on-page optimization strategies across content, metadata, internal linking, and content clusters

Identify content gaps and build scalable content roadmaps

Monitor algorithm updates and proactively adapt strategies to maintain performance

Partner with content, design, development, and marketing teams to integrate SEO into all digital initiatives

Oversee backlink strategy and authority-building initiatives

Analyze performance metrics and present executive-level reports with actionable insights

Mentor junior SEO tea
mbers (if applicable) and establish best practices



Requirements



5+ years of proven SEO experience with measurable growth results

Demonstrated success increasing organic traffic, keyword rankings, and conversions

Strong expertise in technical SEO and website architecture

Deep understanding of search intent, SERP features, and evolving Google algorithms

Advanced experience with tools such as Google Search Console, Google Analytics (GA4), SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, or similar platforms

Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and how development impacts SEO

Experience optimizing Core Web Vitals and page performance

Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into strategic decisions

Excellent communication skills and ability to present insights to stakeholders



Preferred Qualifications:



Familiarity with CRO (conversion rate optimization) and performance marketing

Experience managing large-scale websites or multi-location SEO campaigns

Understanding of content strategy and topic clustering

Experience with enterprise SEO tools such as Search Atlas



What We Offer



Competitive salary based on experience

Access to premium SEO and analytics tools

Opportunity to lead impactful growth initiatives

Collaborative and forward-thinking work environment

Professional development and continued learning opportunities



How to Apply



Please submit your resume, a brief cover letter outlining your SEO achievements, and examples of measurable results or case studies.



Subject line:

“Senior SEO Specialist Application – [Your Name]”

title: Junior Content Copywriter
description:
Hello!



We are one of the largest Amazon FBA coaching programmes in the industry. If you have worked in the business coaching niche at all, you probably will have heard of us. Our business mainly runs off instagram where we have around 200,000 followers.



We are looking to scale our content and ads up and we will need an additional content creator/scriptwriter to help us create more reels and carousels.



If you are a talented and creative writer, this will be a huge opportunity for you to work with an established team. With our current plans to scale fast in the next 3-6 months, there are a LOT of growth and advancement opportunities.



We are planning on putting out a lot more reels, ads, and carousel. If you are able to deliver high quality work on time with creative ideas, there's a LOT of promotions and performance bonuses we can pass on to you.



The role will be simple. Work with our marketing manager to create more scripts and reels. Generally, you will just be responsible for creating the COPY for reels and carousels + adding some basic instructions for the actual designers and editors.



Another perk of this role is you will be closely trained and taught by our marketing manager who is an experienced copywriter and has created the types of content that our company is built on. You will receive feedback and explained edits for all your work, so long as you are open to learning and take in the feedback for next time.



If you think you up to this role and would like a shot at working with us, please send in your proposal with a COPY of this test task: (NOte that the test tasks are not for our company, but a different coach with a similar content style).







let us know if you have any other questions!

title: Real Estate Property Lead Generation
description:
We're a growing short-term rental business in the US scaling to 20+ properties this year. We're looking for a reliable, organized VA to help find and manage property leads then follow up with people through
 and phone calls. Part time now, with potential for full-time. We're looking to hire two VAs. 



They should be a motivated, detail-oriented professional with strong research skills and excellent communication abilities. You'll be responsible for identifying rental properties that fit our housing model, conducting outreach to property owners, and qualifying leads. As our portfolio grows, you'll also support guest communications and operational coordination.



Main Tasks: 



* Pull rental listings from Zillow, 
,
 Marketplace, Craigslist (50-100+ per week)

* Analyze market rental rates and qualify leads

* Respond to property inquiries via messaging platforms,
, and phone calls

* Follow up with leads using provided templates

* Track all outreach, responses, and lead status in our system

* Schedule property viewings

* Build genuine rapport with through professional, friendly communication



What We’re Looking For



Required:



* Excellent English communication skills- both written and spoken, with natural, conversational tone

* Ability to build rapport quickly you're personable, warm, and professional (not stiff or robotic)

* Previous experience with outreach, lead generation, market research, or sales

* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

* Comfortable with Google Sheets/Excel and basic data analysis

* Self-motivated and able to work independently

* Can manage multiple tasks and follow through consistently

* Can craft personalized messages outside of the given generic templates



Preferred (Not Required):



* Experience with Airbnb, real estate, property management, or corporate housing

* Familiarity with rental market research

* Background in customer service or hospitality where building relationships was key

* Previous cold outreach experience with strong response rates



You're NOT The Right Fit If:



* You're uncomfortable having natural phone conversations with strangers

* You need constant supervision and hand-holding on every task

* You struggle with organization or tracking multiple conversations

* You're uncomfortable with outreach or following up persistently

* You avoid taking initiative when problems arise



**Working Hours**



* Project-based: 15-20 hours per week to start

* Philippine timezone \- flexible schedule during your working hours

* Strong potential to become full-time (40+ hours) as we grow to 10-20 properties



Rate:
per hour ($3-5/hour) depending on experience



How to Apply



If you're organized, personable, and excited to help build a growing business, we'd love to hear from you.



To apply, kindly fill out this form:

title: Junior Content Copywriter
description:
Hello!



We are one of the largest Amazon FBA coaching programmes in the industry. If you have worked in the business coaching niche at all, you probably will have heard of us. Our business mainly runs off instagram where we have around 200,000 followers.



We are looking to scale our content and ads up and we will need an additional content creator/scriptwriter to help us create more reels and carousels.



If you are a talented and creative writer, this will be a huge opportunity for you to work with an established team. With our current plans to scale fast in the next 3-6 months, there are a LOT of growth and advancement opportunities. Both professionally and financially. If you do well, we can also give you personalized testimonials.



NOTE: This position will start as a trial to make sure you are a fit for our team. But we are looking for someone who can work and become a dependable tea
mber with us long term. That is where you will have all the advancement opportunities. 



We are planning on putting out a lot more reels, ads, and carousel. If you are able to deliver high quality work on time with creative ideas, there's a LOT of promotions and performance bonuses we can pass on to you.



The role will be simple. Work with our marketing manager to create more scripts and reels. Generally, you will just be responsible for creating the COPY for reels and carousels + adding some basic instructions for the actual designers and editors.



Another perk of this role is you will be closely trained and taught by our marketing manager who is an experienced copywriter and has created the types of content that our company is built on. You will receive feedback and explained edits for all your work, so long as you are open to learning and take in the feedback for next time.



If you think you up to this role and would like a shot at working with us, please send in your proposal with a COPY of this test task: (NOte that the test tasks are not for our company, but a different coach with a similar content style).







let us know if you have any other questions!

?

?



???? Compensation & Growth

Performance-Based Growth: $1,000–$2,000+/month based on results

 • Salary increases are tied solely to performance and revenue impact

???? If you bring results in Month 1, you get rewarded in Month 1.



?



???? What You Will Be Responsible For

 • Continuously testing, optimising, and refining campaign structure

 • Reporting clearly on performance, insights, and next actions



?



???? Ideal Candidate

 • Proven experience running profitable Google Ads campaigns

 • Strong understanding of PPC scaling and optimisation

 • Solid SEO knowledge (keyword research, on-page, technical basics)

 • Data-driven, analytical, and performance-obsessed

 • Comfortable working toward clear revenue targets

 • Proactive, solution-oriented, and detail-focused

 • Treats this role as a full-time career, not a side project

 • Hungry to earn more by delivering real, measurable results



?



???? What Makes This Opportunity Unique

 • Work with a fast-scaling international brand

 • Direct impact on revenue and growth

 • Performance-based pay with immediate upside

 • Long-term stability with strong infrastructure already in place

 • Freedom to implement what works — no micromanagement

 • Opportunity to become our go-to paid media & growth expert

 • A team that values results, ownership, and accountability



We already have strong foundations — now we want someone who can push performance to the next level.



?



? Deliverables

 • Manage and optimise Google Ads campaigns

 • Monitor, analyse, and report PPC performance

 • Improve ROI and conversion efficiency

 • Conduct keyword research and analysis

 • Collaborate on ad copy, creatives, and landing page strategy



?



???? Final Note



This is not a maintenance role.

This is a growth role for someone who wants to scale revenue, be rewarded fairly, and build a long-term position inside a serious company.



NDA WILL NEED TO BE SIGNED BEFORE HIRE



If you’re a true PPC & SEO expert who wants to be paid based on results — not promises — we want to hear from you.



Only experienced, performance-driven applicants should apply.
