title: Content Operations Manager (LONG-TERM & FAST GROWING)
description:
Hey, this is Mark, the CEO at LaunchBoom. We equip creators with the tools, data, and support they need to launch successful products anywhere. Our approach makes every product drop feel like a high-profile, limited-edition release by helping entrepreneurs build excitement, fund their first production run, establish their brand, and grow a ready-made audience that seamlessly transitions into long-term e-commerce success. 



This role focuses on our internal marketing - helping us tell the story of LaunchBoom and why clients can trust our system and experts in their product launch.





ROLE OVERVIEW



We are seeking a highly organized, proactive Content Operation Manager to oversee the planning, production, publishing, and optimization of our content ecosystem (video, podcast, and blog).



This role ensures that all content timelines remain on track, assets are properly prepared, uploads are completed on time, and audience engagement across platforms is managed effectively.



You will work closely with the Creative Director to identify opportunities, resolve production bottlenecks, and continuously improve content performance.





REQUIREMENTS



- Fluent in English

- Work 9 to 5 in PST

- Fast and stable internet





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



1. Content Production & Publishing



-- Maintain and enforce content timelines with editors to ensure consistent weekly releases:

----1 long-form video per week

----1 podcast episode per week

----1 blog post per week

-- Prepare all content assets for upload across platforms.

-- Write episode descriptions and create timestamps.

-- Generate and manage tracking links.

-- Create and manage links for live events and oversee recording logistics.

-- Ensure the content tracker is updated and all uploads are completed on schedule.

-- Stay aligned with the video editor’s timelines and report any friction or delays to the Creative Director.





2. Podcast Editing



-- Edit podcast recordings within Riverside, including trimming, sequencing, and cleaning up audio/video as needed.

-- Download finalized audio/video files from Riverside and prepare them for final production.

-- Complete final edits in professional editing software (e.g., DaVinci Resolve or Final Cut Pro), including:

----Adding branded introductions and outros

----Incorporating graphics, titles, and any required visual elements

----Ensuring audio and visual quality meet brand standards

----Export and upload finished podcast episodes to all required distribution platforms (audio and video), ensuring accurate titles, descriptions, thumbnails, and metadata.

-- Edit multiple short form clips for each podcast episode using Riverside

-- Maintain an organized library of podcast files and ensure all episodes are properly archived and accessible.

-- Continuously refine the editing and publishing workflow to improve efficiency, quality, and turnaround time.





3. Content Development & Strategy



-- Identify gaps or bottlenecks in the content schedule and communicate proactively.

-- Identify opportunities for:

----New podcast topics

----New long-form videos

----Collaborations

----Short-form content initiatives (in partnership with Creative Director)

-- Mock up content topics and draft video scripts.

-- Identify outdated content that requires refreshing or repurposing.

-- Use established scripts and style guides to produce blog posts.

-- Create thumbnails as needed.



We're looking forward to hearing from you! In your application, include a screenshot from the results of an Internet speed test using (https://www.speedtest.net/) and a link to the most viewed video on our main YouTube channel. We'll get back to you within 5 business days after you apply!

title: Senior Accountant
description:
About the Company

We are a fast-growing Australian non-bank lender specialising in real estate-backed private credit.

We provide structured lending solutions to property developers and business owners across Australia.

We operate with institutional funding partners and manage complex loan structures across multiple entities and trust accounts.

We are scaling and building institutional-grade finance operations.

________________________________________

The Role

This is a high-accuracy finance operations role focused on loan account integrity.

You will ensure that all loan accounts, repayments, and balances are 100?curate at all times.

This role is critical to maintaining financial control as the loan book grows.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

• Reconcile borrower repayments against bank statements

• Maintain accurate loan balances in our loan management system

• Track principal, interest, arrears, and adjustments

• Identify and resolve discrepancies

• Prepare:

• Loan statements

• Interest statements

• Payout / discharge figures

• Reconcile trust accounts

• Assist with month-end reporting

• Maintain documentation for audit readiness

• Support internal reporting requirements

________________________________________

Required Experience

• 4+ years experience in loan servicing, loan accounting, or payment reconciliation

• Experience working with Australian lenders or finance firms preferred

• Strong Excel / Google Sheets skills

• High attention to detail

• Strong written English

• Comfortable working Sydney business hours

Experience in non-bank lending, mortgage servicing, or private lending is highly regarded.

________________________________________

Who We’re Looking For

• Detail-obsessed and structured

• Proactive and accountable

• Calm under pressure

• Independent worker

• Long-term mindset

This role will grow as the company scales.

________________________________________

What This Role Is NOT

• Not sales

• Not credit assessment

• Not settlement coordination

• Not collections enforcement

________________________________________

Compensation

• PHP 65,000 to PHP 85,000 per month

• Long-term full-time position

• Performance reviews

• Opportunity to grow into senior finance operations role

________________________________________

Application Instructions

To apply:

1. Write “Loan Integrity” in your subject line

2. Briefly describe your experience with loan reconciliations

3. Confirm your expected salary in PHP

4. Confirm your available working hours (Sydney time)

Shortlisted applicants will complete an assessment prior to interview.

title: Data Scraping & Data Management Specialist (Connecticut Public Records) – Remote
description:
Data Scraping & Data Management Specialist (Connecticut Public Records) – Remote



Job Type

Remote / Virtual (Contract or Full-Time)

Location Focus: Connecticut (statewide)

Hours: Flexible, but must have reliable communication and consistent output



Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scraping & Data Management Specialist to collect, organize, clean, and maintain data from Connecticut public/county/municipal websites and related online sources.



This role is ideal for someone with strong hands-on experience in web scraping, automation, structured data extraction, and database/data quality management. The right candidate is detail-oriented, technically strong, and capable of building repeatable systems that produce accurate, usable datasets.



This is a virtual position and requires someone who can work independently, communicate clearly, and deliver organized data consistently.



Key Responsibilities



-Scrape and extract data from Connecticut public websites (county-level, municipal/town-level, clerk/record portals, tax/assessor sites, GIS/property records, court/public record sources, etc.)

-Build and maintain automated scraping workflows using appropriate tools (APIs, Python scripts, browser automation, etc.)

-Clean, normalize, and standardize raw data into structured formats (CSV, Excel, Google Sheets, databases)

-Merge datasets from multiple sources and maintain data consistency across records

-Perform data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy and completeness

-Create and maintain documentation for scraping processes, data fields, and update schedules

-Monitor source websites for layout/structure changes and quickly adjust scrapers as needed

-Deliver recurring data pulls on schedule (daily/weekly/monthly as required)

-Organize data in a way that is usable for internal operations, analysis, and outreach

-Communicate progress, blockers, and recommendations clearly



Required Qualifications



-Proven experience in web scraping and data extraction (this is a must)

-Strong experience with data management / data cleaning / data organization

-Proficiency with tools/languages such as:

-Python (BeautifulSoup, Scrapy, Requests, Pandas, Selenium/Playwright, etc.)

-SQL / databases

-Excel / Google Sheets / CSV processing

-Experience handling:

-Pagination-

-Dynamic websites / JavaScript-rendered pages

-Inconsistent formatting across sources

-Duplicate detection and record matching

-Strong understanding of data quality control and validation methods

-Ability to work independently and solve problems without constant supervision

-Strong written communication and documentation skills

-Reliable internet and ability to work remotely



Preferred Qualifications (Strong Plus)

-Experience scraping government/public record websites

-Experience with Connecticut-specific public data sources

-Experience with real estate / property / tax / assessor / land record data

-Experience building ETL pipelines and automated update jobs

-Familiarity with APIs, proxies, rate limiting, and responsible scraping practices

-Experience integrating cleaned data into CRMs or internal systems



What Success Looks Like in This Role



-Accurate, structured datasets delivered on time

-Minimal data errors / duplicates

-Repeatable scraping systems that reduce manual work

-Clear documentation and reliable update cadence

-Fast adjustments when websites change

-Compliance & Data Handling Expectations

-Must follow responsible scraping practices and respect website usage limitations

-Must handle data securely and maintain confidentiality of internal workflows and datasets

-Experience working with public records is a plus, but attention to compliance and professional standards is required



Compensation



-Compensation is based on experience and scope (hourly or project-based).

-Please include your rate and preferred structure when applying.



How to Apply



Please send:

-A brief summary of your experience with data scraping and data management

-Examples of past scraping projects (especially public records/government sites, if available)

-Tools/languages you use

-Your availability and turnaround times

-Your hourly rate or project pricing

title: Cold Call Manager / QA-QC & Lead Qualification Manager (Real Estate) – Full-Time
description:
Cold Call Manager / QA-QC & Lead Qualification Manager (Real Estate) – Full-Time



Job Type

Full-Time (Remote / Virtual)

Industry: Real Estate Acquisitions / Lead Generation



Position Overview



We are hiring a full-time Cold Call Manager to oversee our real estate cold-calling operation, manage caller performance, handle QA/QC, and improve lead qualification quality before leads are passed to acquisitions.



This role requires someone who is strong at listening to calls, understanding tone, coaching callers, and identifying where deals are being missed — especially on calls marked as “unqualified” that may actually deserve follow-up.



The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with ReadyModeIQ (ReadyMode), understands dialer management, and knows how to improve both team output and lead quality in a real estate environment.



Core Responsibilities



1) Cold Caller Team Management (Daily)

-Manage and supervise cold callers (full-time / part-time / VA team)

-Track daily performance metrics (dials, connects, conversations, outcomes, appointments)

-Ensure callers followscript, workflow, and disposition standards

-Run daily check-ins, feedback sessions, and performance huddles

-Monitor attendance, consistency, and productivity

-Assign call lists and priorities based on campaign goals

-Payroll



2) QA/QC (Quality Assurance / Quality Control)

-Review and score call recordings for:

-Script adherence

-Professionalism

-Clarity

-Confidence

-Tone and communication style

-Objection handling

-Accuracy of dispositions / call outcomes

-Provide coaching feedback to improve conversion and caller effectiveness

-Identify weak patterns (rushing, poor tone, bad transitions, missed qualifying questions, etc.)

-Maintain and improve QA scorecards and call standards

-Audit CRM notes/tags for accuracy and completeness



3) Unqualified Lead Call Review (Critical)

-Listen to calls marked as “unqualified” to verify whether they were truly unqualified

-Catch missed opportunities caused by:

-Poor caller tone

-Weak follow-up questions

-Incorrect dispositioning

-Failure to build rapport

-Missed seller motivation signals

-Reclassify leads when needed (nurture / warm / follow-up / manager review)

-Coach callers on how to better handle similar situations going forward

-Build a feedback loop to reduce false disqualifications and improve lead quality



4) Lead Qualification & Handoff Control

-Review and qualify leads before they are sent to acquisitions

-Confirm key data points such as:

-Property address

-Seller / decision-maker contact info

-Motivation

-Timeline

-Property condition (if available)

-Price expectation / asking range (if available)

-Occupancy / vacancy

-Best callback time / next step

-Organize leads by status (hot / warm / nurture / disqualified)

-Make manager-level follow-up qualification calls when needed

-Ensure acquisitions receives clean, accurate, actionable lead handoffs



5) ReadyModeIQ / Dialer Management

-Manage and monitor ReadyModeIQ / ReadyMode dialer operations

-Ensure campaigns, caller sessions, and workflows are running correctly

-Troubleshoot dialer-related issues (call flow, agent statuses, campaign setup, etc.)

-Help maintain dialing efficiency while preserving call quality

-Support list loading / campaign organization (as needed)

-Coordinate with leadership on dialing strategy, productivity, and performance optimization



6) Training, Coaching & Process Improvement

-Train new callers on script, tone, qualification, dispositions, and CRM process

-Run roleplays focused on rapport, objection handling, and confidence

-Coach callers on how they sound, not just what they say

-Improve call scripts and qualification flow based on call review trends

-Maintain SOPs for call handling, QA, and lead handoff standards



Required Qualifications



-Proven experience managing cold callers / appointment setters / inside sales teams

-Experience in real estate lead generation (investor, wholesale, acquisitions, brokerage, etc.)

-Strong experience with QA/QC call review and coaching

-Strong ability to evaluate tone, communication style, and seller interaction quality

-Experience reviewing calls marked “unqualified” and identifying missed opportunities

-Hands-on experience with ReadyModeIQ / ReadyMode

-Experience managing a dialer and monitoring caller performance

-Strong understanding of lead qualification and seller motivation

-Strong organization, follow-through, and accountability management

-Experience with CRM systems and accurate lead dispositioning



Preferred Qualifications (Strong Plus)



-Experience in real estate investing (wholesale, fix & flip, novation, seller finance, etc.)

-Experience managing remote teams / overseas callers / VAs

-Experience building QA scorecards and coaching systems

-Familiarity with list stacking, skip tracing, and campaign segmentation

-Ability to pull insights from call recordings and improve scripts/process quickly



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



-Team call consistency and productivity

-Call quality scores (QA/QC)

-Tone/communication improvement across callers

-Lead qualification accuracy

-Reduction in false “unqualified” dispositions

-Number of qualified leads passed to acquisitions

-CRM note/tag accuracy

-Caller coaching progress and performance improvement

-Dialer uptime / campaign efficiency (ReadyModeIQ)



What Success Looks Like in This Role



-Callers sound professional, confident, and consistent

-Fewer good leads are lost due to poor tone or bad qualification

-“Unqualified” leads are properly audited and corrected when needed

-Acquisitions receives stronger, cleaner lead handoffs

-QA/QC and dialer management are organized, consistent, and scalable



Schedule / Availability



-Full-time remote role

-Must be available during core calling hours for target markets

-Daily communication with leadership and acquisitions team required

-Fast response time for caller issues, dialer problems, and lead review needs



Compensation (Example Language)



Compensation based on experience and results. Can include:

-Base salary or hourly (full-time)

-Performance incentives tied to:

-Team qualified leads

-QA performance

-Lead quality improvement

-Reduction in bad / missed lead dispositions

title: Quality Control Photo Editor (Real Estate Media Company)
description:
Monday – Saturday, 7:30 PM–11:30 PM EST (Which is Tuesday - Sunday 8:30AM - 12:30PM PHT) (must match this schedule). Hours may likely move to a full-time position



We’re a busy real estate media company switching to AI editing.We’re looking for someone with a reliable and time-efficient work ethic who is very detail oriented and has good English reading/writing skills. 



Your job will be to quality control all of our photo edits that we run through our AI editing software.



In this role you will:

Review all of our photos to catch common mistakes by the editing software.

Complete photographer notes (Item removals, minor fixes) 

Correct color/lens issues in Photoshop/Lightroom

Upload final galleries to our photo delivery platform.



Required skills:

- Strong Photoshop + Lightroom skills

- Color correction & wall color accuracy

- Lens corrections / distortion awareness

- Basic item removal

- Detail-oriented + fast turnaround

- Strong English

- HDR hand blending

- Virtual twilights / staging knowledge

- Experience with real estate photo editing



Daily workflow:

- 7:30 PM: Pull completed AI photo edits

- Quality control against photographer notes and raw exposures.

- Fix color/lighting consistency, lens corrections, AI artifacts

- Basic item removal in Photoshop

- Upload to Delivery platform

- End-of-shift handoff message for AM team if anything is pending



How to Apply: 

If you are detail-oriented, professional, and excited to support a growing company, we’d love to hear from you. 



Please provide EVERYTHING we ask for to be considered.

Please submit an
 to 
 with the subject “Application - Quality Control Photo Editor”



And include:



Your portfolio (We like to see before and after of photos you’ve edited)



Your updated resume



A short voice or video recording (1-2 minutes long) introducing yourself and explaining your editing experience. 



Internet speed and computer specs. 



A picture of a pink duck. 







Do not apply if you are not okay with the hours of operation. 



If you do not send a portfolio, your application will not be reviewed.

title: Accounting & Operations Assistant - Real Estate
description:
STR Investments is a Chicago-based real estate investment firm that buys, renovates, and operates multifamily apartment communities across the Southeast United States. We own approximately 800–1,000 units across Alabama, Arkansas, and Georgia. Our team is lean, fast-moving, and spread across Chicago and the Philippines. We get things done.



We are looking for a sharp, organized Accounting & Operations Assistant to join our Philippines-based team. You will work closely with our bookkeepers and report to our CFO to keep the financial and operational engine of the business running smoothly.



This is a hands-on execution role. You are not here to manage strategy — you are here to make sure the details are handled correctly, on time, every time. If you take pride in clean books, clear follow-ups, and well-formatted reports, and you want to grow inside a real estate investment firm that is actively expanding — this role is for you.



• 2–3 years of experience in bookkeeping, accounting support, or a finance-related VA role

• Solid QuickBooks Online experience — you can enter transactions, reconcile accounts, and pull basic reports without being trained from zero

• Strong Excel skills — comfortable building and maintaining spreadsheets, formatting reports, using basic formulas

• Excellent written English — your
s and documents are clear and professional

• Detail-oriented and deadline-driven — you do not let things fall through the cracks

• Comfortable working independently and managing your own task list without daily hand-holding

• Reliable internet connection and a quiet, professional working environment

• Experience supporting a US-based real estate, construction, or property management company

• Familiarity with multi-entity accounting (different companies with separate books)

• Experience with Deel, InvestNext, or similar platforms

• Background in accounts payable or vendor management



40 Hours per week - 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM Chicago time (CST)

title: ClickUp Systems & Operations Specialist (E-commerce)
description:
About Us: We are a fast-growing European e-commerce company selling health & beauty products across multiple EU markets. We test products, launch new offers, produce creatives daily, and manage customer support operations at scale. We are transitioning from Google Sheets-based workflows to ClickUp to build a structured and scalable operating system for our team.



Your Mission:

•  Design and build a simple, scalable ClickUp system that our team will use every day.



This includes:



• task & workflow management

• creative production & testing tracking

• product launch pipeline

• customer support workflow

• dashboards & performance tracking

• automations & Google Sheets integrations



Your work will directly improve team efficiency and reduce operational chaos.



• Responsibilities

• ClickUp Workspace Architecture



• Design scalable workspace structure

• Create Spaces, Lists, statuses & custom fields

• Build templates & SOP structure



Creative Workflow System



• Build creative request ? production ? review ? approval flow

• Create creative testing & performance tracking

• Build a Winners database & tracking system

• Ensure clear priorities & deadlines for designers



Product Launch Workflow



• Build step-by-step launch pipeline

• Create launch checklists & task templates

• Define responsibilities & status flow

• Automate next-step task creation



Customer Support Workflow



• Build ticket & issue tracking system

• Create order issue resolution flow

• Set up address verification & COD confirmation tracking

• Ensure priority & status visibility



Automations & Integrations



• Connect Google Sheets with ClickUp

• Set up automations & triggers

• Use Zapier / Make (Integromat) if needed



Dashboards & Reporting

Create dashboards showing:



• winning creatives

• best angles & markets

• hit ratio & performance trends

• launch status

• operational bottlenecks



Team Workflow & Daily Operations



You will design systems that our team uses daily.



The system must be:



• simple & intuitive

• easy for non-technical users

• optimized for daily execution

• structured but not complicated



Requirements



• Strong ClickUp experience (workspace architecture & automations)

• Experience building team workflows & task systems

• Experience with Zapier / Make integrations

• Experience connecting Google Sheets

• Process-oriented & detail-focused

• Good written English



BONUS (not required)

• e-commerce or marketing workflow experience

• understanding of performance metrics (CPA, ROAS, CTR)



Working Hours

•  Each time when we need to help and cooperate - we are looking someone for the long-term cooperation.



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)

• To be considered, include:



1) ClickUp systems you have built

2) Automation tools you have used

3) Experience integrating Google Sheets

4) Screenshot/example of a dashboard you created

5) How you keep workflows simple for teams

6) Biggest mistake companies make with ClickUp

7) Start your application with the word SYSTEM



Applications without these will not be reviewed.



We are looking for a long-term partner to help us build a scalable operating system for our company.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
PropZap — Building the Future of Real Estate in North America



PropZap is building a next-generation real estate platform designed to expand across North America.



We are pioneers in how modern real estate companies should be built — powered by strong systems, smart technology, data-driven decision-making, and operational efficiency.



We’re building with intention.

With structure.

With technology at the core.

With performance that compounds over time.



Our goal is to create a brand that sets the standard. A company that leads. A platform built to scale intelligently and sustainably across markets.



And for the right person, this isn’t just a job inside that company.



It’s a front-row seat to its growth.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Role: Marketing Manager

Location: Remote

Shift: Aligned with Canada MST

Role Type: Any

Compensation: 50,000 PHP+



We believe great people build great companies. If you can truly take ownership of growth and deliver measurable results, we are willing to offer premium compensation. Strong operators who scale performance will be rewarded at the top end of the market.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Why This Role Is a Big Opportunity for You



If you’ve been jumping from company to company…

If you’ve worked in roles where your ideas weren’t implemented…

If you’ve delivered results but never had real ownership…



This is different.



Here, your work directly influences growth.



You won’t be a small piece inside a giant machine.

You’ll help build the machine.



As the company scales across markets, your scope expands. Your influence grows. Your leadership potential increases.



This role has a clear path toward future Head of Marketing for someone who wants to build long term — not just manage campaigns quarter to quarter.



You’ll be building something that compounds — and your career compounds with it.



--------------------------------------------------------------



What You’ll Be Doing



Meta Ads Leadership (Most Critical)

• Manage and scale large-budget Meta Ads campaigns

• Architect structured campaign systems designed for scale

• Plan creative angles, hooks, and positioning

• Write high-converting direct-response ad copy

• Produce ad creatives (graphics/video)

• Execute disciplined A/B testing

• Optimize based on cost per qualified lead and full-funnel performance



Landing Page Optimization (Squarespace)

• Optimize and improve our existing landing page (
)

• Increase conversion rates through structured experimentation

• Strengthen messaging clarity and calls-to-action

• Ensure tracking accuracy and clean data flow



 Marketing & Lead Management (HubSpot)

• Build and refine nurture sequences

• Segment and organize new and existing leads

• Implement clean tagging systems

• Improve engagement and conversion rates

• Ensure seamless handoff of qualified leads



Analytics, Tracking & Attribution

• Implement advanced tracking systems (Pixel, CAPI, UTM strategy)

• Maintain clear attribution from click to handoff

• Analyze full-funnel performance

• Identify bottlenecks and recommend improvements

• Document A/B tests and build repeatable optimization frameworks



Marketing Innovation & Leadership

• Proactively suggest growth ideas

• Stay updated on new tools, platforms, and strategies

• Serve as the internal expert for performance marketing

• Guide leadership decisions with data-backed insights



--------------------------------------------------------------



Who This Is Perfect For



This role is ideal for someone who wants stability with upside.



Someone who wants to stop freelancing unpredictably and build something consistent.

Someone who enjoys ownership and wants their work to matter.



• Proven hands-on experience managing significant Meta Ads budgets

• Strong understanding of direct-response marketing

• Comfortable with analytics and attribution

• Strong copywriting and creative strategy skills

• Structured and disciplined with testing



Highly Ideal:

• Real estate marketing experience

• Experience generating buyer or seller leads

• Experience promoting brokerages



Bonus If You Have:

• SEO experience

• Google Ads experience

• AI tools and automation knowledge

• Zapier or workflow automation experience



--------------------------------------------------------------



What You’ll Gain



• Premium compensation aligned with performance

• Long-term stability inside a scaling company

• Direct collaboration with founders

• Real ownership and influence over strategy

• Clear path toward leadership

• The ability to grow as the company grows



Imagine being two or three years into a company that has expanded across multiple markets — and knowing you helped build the engine that powered that expansion.



That’s the opportunity here.



We’re building something designed to grow.



If you want your career to grow with it, we’d love to meet you.



--------------------------------------------------------------



How to Apply



Send the following to: 



• Resume (required)

• Portfolio (required)

• Case studies or performance summaries of Meta campaigns (required)

• Summary of budgets managed (required)

• Intro video (preferred)

• Expected monthly compensation (required)

• Internet speed test link (required)

• Any DISC test result (if available)



Subject Line: Performance Marketing Manager – Your Name



If you’re ready to stop hopping and start building something that scales — this might be the role you’ve been waiting for.

title: Closer/SDR Appt Setter for Ebay Coaching Academy
description:
This role is for ecommerce academy that offers high ticket coaching programs for beginners to exceed on selling on ebay or amazon. PLEASE READ THE JOB POST TILL THE END



This position is becoming a sales phone dialer for the company where you will be calling people who opted in to our free materials and booking them into calls where we will close them into high ticket programs. As well as following up with previous clients to cross sell them into more packages. 



If you do not fit these requirements below please do not bother applying.

Requirements:

-Previous sales and calling experience

-Collected or contributed at least $100k into company sales

-No accent

-Work USA hours 10am-7pm EST

-Have at least 3 sales call recordings to send

-Disciplined and can dial at least 100 to 200 leads a day

-Experience with gohighlevel, 
 and ecommerce preferred



Roles:

-Calling lead opt ins within 5 minutes of opt in and booking them into calls

- Following and calling leads who did not pickup the first time for 7 consecutive days

-Reaching out to already booked calls a few hours before appointment to make sure they will show up, hype for the call and presold for the closers.

-Calling and sending consecutive follow up SMS's for leads that joined the call but did not close and had a few objections

-Following up leads that no showed or canceled calls. Rebooking them into new days

-Updating our CRM system (Gohighlevel) and maintaining organized lead tracking

-Communicating clearly with the sales and marketing team to ensure smooth handoffs

- Updating google sheets with lead info and tracking



Salary is $2k to $5k/month



Please send a message with a intro video of your previous experience and sales call recordings! If you do not have sales call recordings send a mock roleplay call for you dialing a lead who opted into a free ebay training and your goal is to do a progress check, discover pain points, financial qualify and set them into a longer call with manager on how we can help them in detail.



If you do not send these in the initial message you will get ignored. This is a high paying job with lots of rewards and we are hiring urgently.

title: Experienced Credit Repair Virtual Assistant (VA)
description:
About US

Resell Signals School is a fast-growing e-commerce education and automation company helping individuals build profitable online businesses. Many of our clients qualify for high-ticket programs, and we’re adding credit repair support to help them improve eligibility and financial positioning.



We are looking for a highly experienced Credit Repair VA who has already worked with credit repair clients or companies and can step in immediately without training.



Who This Role Is For (Important)

? You MUST have prior credit repair experience

? You MUST have worked with real clients, not just theory

? You MUST be comfortable using credit repair software & CRMs

? This is NOT a beginner role

? We will NOT train from scratch



Key Responsibilities-



Guide clients step-by-step through the credit repair process

Explain disputes, removals, credit factors, utilization, and timelines clearly

Review client credit reports and identify issues (collections, charge-offs, inquiries, etc.)

Assist with dispute workflows based on existing systems

Answer client questions confidently and accurately

Client Guidance (Not Sales)

Support and educate clients — not closing or selling





Help clients understand:

What actions they need to take

What documents are required

What realistic results and timelines look like

Set proper expectations without overpromising

Software & Tools

Work inside credit repair software (e.g. Credit Repair Cloud or similar)

Update CRM notes, client statuses, and progress





Communicate via:


Chat/

Internal CRM systems

Customer Support

Respond to client questions professionally and promptly

Handle objections or confusion calmly and clearly

Escalate complex cases to management when needed





Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)

To apply, you must have:

1+ year experience working in credit repair (agency or freelance)







Hands-on experience disputing:



Collections

Late payments

Charge-offs

Inquiries

Experience communicating directly with clients

Familiarity with credit laws and concepts (FCRA basics, utilization, derogatories, etc.)

Experience using credit repair software

Strong written English communication skills





Nice to Have (Bonus)

Experience working with U.S.-based clients

Experience in coaching, education, or financial services

Familiarity with funding preparation or business credit

Experience working alongside high-ticket programs



Work Details

Remote

Part-time to full-time (based on performance)

Long-term position for the right person

Competitive pay based on experience







How to Apply-



When applying, please include:

Your credit repair experience (company names or client types)

What credit repair software you’ve used

A brief example of how you would explain credit repair timelines to a client

Your availability (hours per week)

Applications without proven credit repair experience will not be considered.

title: Bookkeeping (Australian experience, part<telegram class=
description:
About the Role



We are seeking an experienced Remote Bookkeeper with strong knowledge of the Australian taxation environment to support our business on an hourly, ongoing basis. This role is ideal for someone who is highly organised, detail-oriented, and confident managing day-to-day financial operations independently.



Key Responsibilities



- Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records

- Reconcile bank, credit card, and payment gateway accounts

- Process accounts payable and accounts receivable

- Work with accountants to prepare BAS, GST, PAYG, and other compliance-related documentation

- Support payroll processing and superannuation requirements

- Assist with month-end and year-end financial reporting

- Communicate with accountants, ATO (when required), and internal stakeholders

- Provide general bookkeeping support as needed



Requirements



- Proven experience as a bookkeeper (3+ years preferred)

- Strong knowledge of Australian tax laws, BAS, GST, and payroll obligations

- Proficiency with Xero accounting software

- Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

- Strong communication skills and ability to work independently

- Reliable internet connection and ability to work remotely

- Availability to work on an hourly, as-needed basis



Preferred



- Experience working with small to medium Australian businesses

- Familiarity with Xero cloud-based bookkeeping tools and relevant automation systems



How to Apply



Please submit your resume along with a brief cover letter outlining your bookkeeping experience, software proficiency, and knowledge of Australian tax requirements.

title: Social Media Manager
description:
PropZap is building a next-generation real estate platform designed to expand across North America.



We are pioneers in how modern real estate companies should be built — powered by strong systems, smart technology, data-driven decision-making, and operational efficiency.



We’re not following outdated playbooks.



We’re building with intention.

With structure.

With technology at the core.

With performance that compounds over time.



Our goal is to create a recognizable brand across markets — one that agents are proud to join, clients trust, and competitors respect.



And to build a brand at that level, we need someone who wants to help shape how we show up to the world.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Role: Social Media Manager

Location: Remote

Shift: Aligned with Canada MST

Role Type: Any

Compensation: 50,000 PHP+



We believe strong creatives deserve strong compensation. For someone who can truly take ownership of our brand presence and elevate how we show up online, we are willing to pay premium for quality and consistency.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Why This Role Is a Big Opportunity for You



If you’ve worked in social media roles where you were just “the poster”…

If you’ve had ideas that never got approved…

If you’ve wanted more ownership but were boxed into small tasks…



This is different.



Here, you help build the brand.



You won’t just execute content — you’ll influence how an expanding company is perceived across markets.



As we grow, our visibility grows.

As our visibility grows, your creative influence grows with it.



This role evolves as the company scales. What starts as full ownership of social content can expand into larger brand leadership opportunities over time.



If you’re looking for stability, long-term growth, and a place where your creativity actually matters — this is that kind of role.



--------------------------------------------------------------



What You’ll Be Doing



This is a brand-building role with full content ownership.



You’ll handle content from ideation to execution — including editing, graphic design, marketing materials, feature sheets, publishing, inbox management, and performance tracking.



There will be some short-form reels, but this role is not heavily focused on daily short-form volume. Quality and positioning matter more than quantity.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Your Core Responsibilities



Full-Cycle Content Ownership



Content Ideation & Strategy

• Develop BGC-focused content aligned with brand positioning

• Generate original ideas that educate, attract, and convert

• Plan content calendars and campaign themes



Content Production & Editing

• Edit short-form video when required (not high-volume)

• Support long-form video editing when needed

• Create graphics, carousels, thumbnails, and branded visuals

• Design professional feature sheets

• Create marketing materials for listings and property campaigns

• Develop branded materials for launches and promotions

• Maintain brand consistency across all platforms



Publishing & Platform Management

• Write optimized captions and calls-to-action

• Schedule and post content across relevant platforms

• Respond to inbox messages and inquiries professionally

• Monitor comments and community interaction

• Track analytics and performance metrics

• Maintain organized content archives



Property Marketing Support

• Assist with posting properties on social platforms

• Potentially post listings in
 Marketplace when appropriate

• Support listing visibility and campaign execution



Occasional UGC Coordination

• Source, organize, or lightly edit user-generated content when applicable



You are responsible for turning raw ideas into polished, conversion-ready media that reflects a modern, credible brand.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Who This Role Is Perfect For



Someone who wants more than just managing an account.



Someone who enjoys creative ownership.



Someone who wants to look back in two or three years and say, “I helped build that brand.”



• 2–5+ years experience in social media management or digital marketing

• Strong video editing skills

• Graphic design proficiency (Canva, Adobe Suite, or similar tools)

• Experience creating real estate marketing materials preferred

• Strong English communication skills

• Comfortable managing multiple content streams

• Reliable internet and professional remote setup



Bonus If You Have:

• Meta Ads campaign experience

• Canadian or U.S. real estate marketing exposure

• Experience growing business or brand accounts

• Performance marketing mindset



--------------------------------------------------------------



What You’ll Gain



• Premium compensation aligned with performance

• Creative ownership and autonomy

• Direct collaboration with founders and leadership

• Long-term opportunity inside a scaling North American platform

• The chance to build a brand that expands across markets

• A role that grows as the company grows



If you’re tired of hopping between accounts and want to invest your creativity into something that’s scaling — this is the kind of environment where that pays off.



We’re building something designed to expand.



If you want your work to expand with it, we’d love to meet you.



--------------------------------------------------------------



How to Apply



Send the following to: 



• Resume

• Portfolio (required — include social accounts or work samples)

• Intro video (preferred / optional)

• Expected monthly compensation

• Internet speed test link

• Any DISC test result (if available)



Subject Line: Social Media Manager – Your Name



NOTE: Failure to follow the application instructions exactly will result in disqualification. Attention to detail matters — how you apply reflects how you execute.



Learn more about us:

title: Direct Response Video Editor
description:
We’re looking for a full time (40 hours per week) experienced Direct Response Video Editor who takes pride in thoughtful, engaging work and enjoys being part of a supportive, mission-driven team.



Our company creates fitness and yoga content for adults over 50, and we’re excited to welcome someone reliable, communicative, and detail-oriented to grow with us long-term.



You’ll receive raw video/audio along with clear creative direction. From there, we’re looking for someone who enjoys shaping content into compelling short-form videos (15–90 seconds) that feel natural, polished, and aligned with our brand voice.



Skills we’re looking for:

+ Editing clips into engaging short-form ads (15–90 sec)

+ Creating smooth transitions between scenes

+ Green screen editing

+ Adding B-roll thoughtfully

+ Caption overlays

+ Merging audio tracks cleanly

+ Sourcing appropriate copyright-free background music



We value clear, steady communication. We connect at least once per week for asset delivery, feedback, and revisions to keep projects flowing smoothly and on schedule.



Experience or interest in fitness and yoga for people 50+ is a big plus — especially if you enjoy creating content that genuinely helps people feel stronger and more confident.



If this feels aligned, we’d love to hear from you. Please reply with:

+ A link to a 15-second short you’ve created

+ A link to a 30-second short

+ A link to a 30–60 second longer-form piece

+ The equipment you use

+ Your internet stability and upload/download speeds



We’re excited to find someone who wants full time (40 hours per week) consistent work, meaningful projects, and a positive creative partnership.

title: Social Media Manager and Growth Marketer
description:
True Value Rankings (TVR) is a financial technology platform that provides educational tools and research frameworks for evaluating cryptocurrencies based on measurable fundamentals rather than hype or speculation. We help users understand what drives long-term value in digital assets through transparent scoring methodologies, analytical tools, and in-depth educational content.



We are an independent startup preparing for public launch. We answer to our users, not outside investors, which means every decision is driven by what makes the product better, not what makes a boardroom happy. You can see our pre-launch page at 
.



This is a ground-floor opportunity to shape a product's marketing strategy from day one. If you have ever wanted to build something from scratch rather than maintain what someone else built, keep reading.





THE ROLE



We are looking for a Growth Marketer and Social Media Manager who can help us build a loyal, engaged audience and convert that attention into paying subscribers after our public launch. This is not a "schedule some posts and call it a day" role. We need someone who thinks strategically about funnels, conversions, and audience building, and who can also execute the day-to-day content and community management that makes it all work.



You will be the driving force behind our social media presence across multiple platforms. You will collaborate closely with the TVR team on content creation and platform selection, gradually taking on more ownership as you become familiar with our product and voice.





PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: GROWTH MARKETING & SOCIAL MEDIA



- Help develop and execute a social media growth strategy across multiple platforms (helping identify which platforms are the best fit for our audience is part of the role)

- Help create, schedule, and publish engaging content that drives traffic to the TVR website (using tools like FeedHive or similar scheduling platforms)

- Help build and grow our audience from zero to a thriving community of people interested in cryptocurrency fundamental analysis

- Help design a content funnel: social media content that brings visitors to the free site, and nurture strategies that convert free users into paying subscribers

- Monitor and respond to comments and engagement across all platforms, filtering out spam and trolls while identifying and nurturing genuine conversations

- Track performance metrics (follower growth, engagement rates, click-throughs, conversions) and report on what is working and what is not

- Create or source visual content (graphics, short videos, infographics) to support posts

- Collaborate with the team on content ideas and contribute to the editorial calendar

- Repurpose long-form content (educational articles, coin analyses) into platform-specific social media content. One article should become multiple posts optimized for each platform's format and audience.

- Help manage
 marketing campaigns and newsletter content through MailerLite





SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES: VIRTUAL ASSISTANT TASKS



- Filter and organize social media replies and messages, flagging items that require a team response

- Assist with formatting and uploading content to the website

- Help manage the newsletter subscriber list and
 workflows

- Light research tasks as needed (competitor analysis, content ideas, trending topics in the space)

- General administrative support related to the TVR platform





A NOTE ABOUT THIS ROLE



Our analysis methodology produces results based on measurable fundamentals. Sometimes those results challenge popular opinion within cryptocurrency communities. This means our social media will occasionally attract strong reactions from passionate supporters of specific projects. We see this as an opportunity, not a problem. The right person for this role is someone who can engage professionally with criticism, turn heated 
nts into teaching opportunities, and remain calm and measured when others are not. If you thrive under that kind of challenge, you will love this role.





REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS



- C2 (Advanced/Proficient) English language skills, both written and verbal. This is non-negotiable. You will be writing public-facing content and representing the brand.

- At least 1 year of experience managing social media accounts for a business or brand (not personal accounts). You must be able to provide links to accounts you have managed.

- Demonstrated ability to grow a social media following and drive measurable engagement (provide at least one example with results)

- Strong written communication skills with clean grammar and a professional tone

- Experience creating visual content for social media (graphics, short-form video, infographics)

- Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision

- Comfortable with weekly video calls for strategy discussions

- Comfortable working within detailed brand guidelines and receiving regular feedback on content. We approve all posts before publishing, especially in the early stages, and we need someone who thrives in a collaborative feedback loop rather than resisting it.

- Strong proactive communication skills. In a remote, asynchronous environment, we need someone who flags issues, shares updates, and proposes solutions without being asked.

- Proficient in using AI tools (such as Claude, Gemini, X.ai, Midjourney, or similar) as part of a professional workflow. We are not looking for casual users. We want someone who actively integrates AI into their work to move faster and produce better results.

- Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace for video calls

- Experience with growth marketing, conversion funnels, or
 marketing strategy

- Basic graphic design skills (Canva or similar tools)





PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (NICE TO HAVE)



- Familiarity with cryptocurrency or fintech (you do not need to be an expert, but genuine curiosity about the space is a strong plus)

- Experience with social media scheduling tools (FeedHive, Buffer, Hootsuite, or similar)

- Experience with
 marketing platforms (MailerLite, Mailchimp, or similar)

- Basic video editing skills (for short-form social content)

- Experience working with startups or early-stage companies

- Experience with Google Analytics or similar web analytics tools (understanding traffic sources, user behavior, and conversion tracking)

- Experience building a social media presence from scratch (growing from zero), not just managing established accounts

- Basic understanding of SEO principles (keyword awareness, meta descriptions, content structure for search visibility)





SCHEDULE, COMPENSATION & LOGISTICS



- Part-time: 20 hours per week (4 hours/day, 5 days/week) with the possibility of increasing to 30-40 hours as the platform grows

- Starting pay rate: $6-10+ USD/hour depending on experience and qualifications, with structured milestone raises tied to measurable platform growth. As the platform succeeds, your compensation grows with it. Full details discussed with shortlisted candidates.

- The first 2 weeks serve as a mutual trial period for both sides to confirm the fit.

- Payment method: Wise

- Flexible schedule: Most work can be done on your own time since posts will be scheduled in advance. We do ask for availability during peak engagement hours when possible, and one weekly video strategy call with the team.

- This is a contractor position with no tax withholding or benefits requirements

- Start date: Late February / Early March 2026





WHY JOIN TVR?



- Ground-floor opportunity: You will shape the marketing strategy from day one, not inherit someone else's playbook

- Growth potential: As the platform scales, so does your role, your hours, and your compensation. We are building this for the long term.

- Creative ownership: We want your ideas and your voice, not just your hands on a keyboard

- Work with a team that values quality over speed, honesty over hype, and substance over noise

- Learn about fintech, data-driven analysis, and the cryptocurrency industry while getting paid to do it





HOW TO APPLY



We read every application carefully. To help us identify serious candidates, please include ALL FOUR of the following in your application:



1. SUBJECT LINE KEYWORD: Include the phrase "Steady Growth" somewhere in the subject line of your application. This tells us you read the entire posting.



2. PORTFOLIO LINKS: Provide links to at least 2 social media accounts you have managed for a business or brand (not your personal accounts). For each one, include a brief note about the results you achieved (follower growth, engagement metrics, or any other relevant numbers).



3. BEST CAMPAIGN: Share a link to one social media campaign or piece of content you are most proud of, with a short explanation (2-3 sentences) of why it worked and what results it produced.



4. WRITTEN RESPONSE: In 3-5 sentences, explain in your own words what "fundamental analysis" means when evaluating an investment. There is no single right answer. We are looking for clear thinking and strong writing, not technical expertise.



Applications that do not include all four items will not be reviewed. We know this takes extra effort, and that is the point. We are looking for someone who pays attention to detail and follows through.





We look forward to hearing from you.



True Value Rankings |

title: Customer Care Specialist - Remote
description:
About MyMagicHealer

MyMagicHealer is a mission-driven skincare brand supporting people with painful, sensitive skin flare-ups. Many people come to us after searching for answers and natural ways to support their skin.

In Customer Care, we are the bridge between the brand and the customer.

Every message matters.

Every interaction shapes how someone feels about their healing journey.

We’re building a high-performing Customer Care department and would love for you to join our mission-driven team.



Read below if you’re a fit.



Who This Role Is For

This role is for someone who:

Thinks critically instead of waiting for instructions

Can operate confidently even when processes aren’t fully built

Understands customers and adapts support to different situations

Protects the brand fairly without compromising the customer experience

Knows how to flip a tough 
nt into trust

Cares about outcomes and how customers feel, not just closing tickets

Spots process gaps and suggests improvements (SOPs, workflows, tools)

If you only follow scripts, this role is not a fit.

If you lead with judgment and customer care, keep reading.



What You’ll Do

Support customers via Instagram,
, TikTok Shop, and Zendesk 
 + chat)

Provide fast, customized responses (not copy/paste only)

Investigate before replying (order history, tracking, past conversations)

Handle product questions, shipping, refunds, and escalations with clear next steps

Respond to public comments/reviews in a calm, brand-aligned voice

Escalate complex/high-risk cases with strong internal documentation

Follow SOPs while flagging gaps and improvement opportunities



What Success Looks Like

Customers are supported quickly during your shift (target: within 30 minutes)

Tense situations are handled calmly 

Brand trust is protected at all times

Issues are solved with minimal back-and-forth

You proactively improve workflows, not just follow them



Requirements

2+ years e-commerce customer support 
 + chat required)

Experience handling public-facing comments or reviews

Strong written English 

Comfortable with accountability and performance metrics

Reliable internet and ability to work set hours (PST)



Schedule

Remote, long-term role

Set working hours required (share availability in PST)



How to Apply (Required)

Please include ALL items below in one message.



1) Short Video Intro (2–3 minutes)

Please include a Loom or short video covering:

Introduce yourself

Why you believe you’re a strong fit for MyMagicHealer and this role



2) Scenario Assessment

Answer all 5 scenarios below. 

Scenario 1

A customer used Flare Care for 4 days and said it didn’t cure their condition. They demand a full refund.

How do you respond?



Scenario 2

You discover an order never shipped due to an internal error. The customer has been waiting 10 days and is upset.

How do you handle this?



Scenario 3

A customer says another agent promised a refund outside policy, but you see no documentation.

What steps do you take and how do you communicate with the customer?



Scenario 4

A customer broke their Flare Care jar after 3 months. They don’t want to pay and are asking for a replacement.

How do you respond?



Scenario 5

A customer comments publicly:

“This product is a scam. Don’t buy it.”

How do you respond publicly?



3) Practical Details

Internet speed (upload + download)

Available working hours in PST

Expected monthly compensation



We are looking for someone who thinks critically, takes ownership, and wants to help build a world-class Customer Care department.

If that’s you, apply.

title: Vacation Rental Listings Manager
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:



Fieldtrip 
 is a luxury hospitality + real estate firm specializing in the acquisition, development, and management of premium branded short-term rentals. We aspire to be the leading boutique hospitality brand in the luxury short-term rental space, currently operating over $200M in assets, with an additional $50M+ in homes, boutique hotels, and glamping projects in development. Our collection includes the world-famous Invisible House, as well as one of the nation’s largest purpose-built short-term rental portfolios. We own or exclusively manage the assets in our portfolio, selectively partnering with family offices, investment firms, developers, and homeowners who share our vision and seek to be part of our curated collection.



Hospitality is at the core of what we do. Our properties are professionally designed to the Fieldtrip brand standard, allowing us to scale and operate our portfolio like a distributed full-service boutique hotel. At each destination, our professional local teams facilitate a seamless and unique experience for our discerning travelers by ensuring that our homes are in perfect condition and prepared for our guests’ specific needs. Our Experience Curation team, dedicated concierge, and 24/7 Guest Experience team provide prompt support and curate bespoke travel experiences and immersive activities. The quality of our white-glove service is evident in our 3000+ 5-star ratings.



POSITION SUMMARY:



We are looking for a full-time Listings Manager to serve as the expert in ensuring vacation rental properties are effectively marketed across multiple booking channels. This includes creating and managing engaging property listings, integrating the PMS with Online Travel Agencies (OTAs), and ensuring all listings are accurate and up-to-date at all times. This role requires a detail-oriented individual with excellent organizational and communication skills, with experience in revenue management being a plus.



RESPONSIBILITIES:



- Create and Manage Listings: Write compelling and accurate job listings for new vacation rental properties. 

- OTA Integration: Ensure listings on various OTAs (such as Airbnb, VRBO, 
, etc.) are integrated and synchronized with the channel manager.

- Ensure Listing Accuracy: Regularly review and update property listings to ensure accuracy and completeness in the copy, photos, amenities, and other settings.

- Optimize Listings: Use data and feedback to optimize listings for maximum visibility and bookings.

- Coordinate Onboarding Process: Work closely with the operations team to gather necessary information and ensure a smooth onboarding process.

- Quality Assurance: Conduct regular audits of listings to maintain high standards and identify any discrepancies.

- Collaborate with Teams: Work collaboratively with marketing, sales, and guest service teams to ensure consistency and quality across all platforms.

- Monitor Performance: Track and analyze listing performance to make data-driven improvement decisions.



QUALIFICATIONS:



- Must have excellent English skills, both written and verbal.

- Must have the ability to solve technical setup problems through relentless use of resources, tenacity, and attention to detail.

- Must have at least 2 (preferably 3+) years of experience working in the short-term rental (AirBNB) space, ideally in a listings management role, but with guest experience management or remote operations management at a minimum.

- Must have experience working with a US, Canada, Australia, or UK-based employer.

- Must have experience managing processes.

- Must have experience with online travel agency platforms such as AirBnB, VRBO, Marriott HVMI, etc.

- Experience with Streamline, Guesty, or equivalent reservation management system strongly preferred.

- Experience with Microsoft Office, Google Suite, 
, and Slack highly preferred.

- Position is full time (40-45 hours/week).



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:

Monthly Salary: $900-$1100

Bonus Details: 13th month bonus



Benefits:

- Health insurance

- Paid time off such as PTO, sick days, and vacation days



IMPORTANT: 



Please read the instructions carefully before applying. Please do not apply directly through Online Jobs Philippines. Only applications submitted through our application tracking system will be considered. Apply here: 



This role requires strong attention to detail—and that begins with how you apply. To be considered, all required materials must be submitted in full at the time of application. Incomplete submissions will not be reviewed. If you’re not yet ready to submit all items, we kindly ask that you wait until you are. This ensures fairness and helps us keep the process efficient for everyone.

title: FORECLOSURE SURPLUS FUNDS RECOVERY
description:
Title: Experienced VA for Foreclosure Surplus Funds Start-Up

About Us:

We’re a small but passionate U.S.-based start-up helping homeowners recover their foreclosure surplus funds. Our mission is simple — to reunite people with money that’s rightfully theirs. We’re now looking for an experienced Virtual Assistant who knows this industry inside and out and can help us scale efficiently while keeping our client-focused approach at heart.

Who We’re Looking For:

We want someone who’s been in this field before — someone who understands how surplus recovery works, from researching surplus lists to preparing claim packages. You’ll have plenty of independence, but also direct communication with the founder, making your ideas and input valuable from day one.

What You’ll Be Doing:

 • Research foreclosure or tax sale records to identify surplus opportunities

 • Skip trace and contact owners or heirs with available surplus funds

 • Prepare claim documents, affidavits, and supporting paperwork

 • Manage leads and maintain detailed client records in our CRM

 • Draft and send client correspondence 
s, letters, updates)

 • Help refine our systems to make everything smoother and more efficient

What You Bring:

 • Direct experience in foreclosure surplus recovery (a must)

 • Excellent English skills — clear, professional, and personable

 • Strong research and document organization skills

 • Familiar with Google Workspace, spreadsheets, and online databases

 • Reliable, detail-oriented, and good at managing multiple tasks

 • Comfortable working U.S. hours (EST preferred)

What’s In It For You:

 • Competitive pay with performance-based growth opportunities

 • Work closely with the founder — your role and ideas truly matter

 • Long-term, stable position with room to grow as the business scales

 • Supportive, flexible startup environment that values initiative and trust

How to Apply:

Please include:

 1. Your updated resume (highlighting your experience in the surplus/overage niche)

 2. A short voice or video introduction (optional but appreciated)

 3. A quick note on why you enjoy this line of work and how you can help us grow

title: Customer Experience Professional
description:
Join one of Australia’s Fastest Growing Modern Furniture Brands!



At Life Interiors, we’re passionate about making great design accessible to all. As one Australia’s most rapidly expanding homeware and furniture brand, we’re committed to delivering exceptional experiences for both our customers and our team.



The role



We are seeking a proactive and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Customer Service Representative. This role will emphasize building and maintaining strong, long-term relationships with our customers. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills, a positive attitude, and a passion for ensuring customer satisfaction while fostering loyalty and trust.



What you’ll be doing:



*Customer Relationship Management: Develop and maintain strong, lasting relationships with customers to enhance their

experience with the company. Ensure customers feel valued, heard, and well-supported throughout their journey.

*Issue Resolution: Act as the primary point of contact for customer inquiries, concerns, or issues. Respond promptly and

effectively to ensure customer satisfaction.

*Proactive Outreach: Reach out to existing customers to ensure continued satisfaction, gather feedback, and identify

opportunities for improvements in products or services.

*Customer Retention: Implement strategies and best practices to drive customer retention, resolve complaints effectively,

and maximize overall satisfaction.

*Customer Education: Provide clear and concise information about products or services ensuring customers understand all

offerings and are equipped to make informed decisions.

*Feedback Collection: Collect and analyze customer feedback to identify trends, needs, and areas for improvement,

collaborate with other departments to address concerns.

*Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with sales, marketing, and product teams to ensure customers’ needs are met and that customer feedback is communicated effectively to relevant teams.

*Reporting and Documentation: Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, transactions, and feedback using CRM

tools or customer service platforms.



Great to have:



*Independent and able to work minimal training or supervision, quickly learning new tasks and systems.

*Strong attention to detail, skilled at identifying the root cause of customer issues and resolving them accurately in

accordance with established processes.

*Ability to remain focused, effective, and make sound decisions in challenging situations.

*Demonstrate strong time management skills and be able to handle several customer requests or tasks at the same time

without affecting the quality of service.

*Adaptive, can adjust to new priorities, and use new tools or processes easily.

*Assertive and can confidently provide and receive constructive feedback with management in a clear, direct, and respectful manner, without fear of rejection or conflict.

* We also welcome those who were previously employed by Temple and Webster, Lounge Lovers and other Australian Furniture experience (A huge plus!)







What we are looking for:



*Proven experience in customer service, relationship management, or a similar role.

*Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written).

*Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to build rapport with customers and internal teams.

*Ability to handle difficult or sensitive situations with tact and professionalism.

*Problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.

*Familiarity with CRM systems and other customer service software is preferred.

*Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

*Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

*High level of empathy and emotional intelligence to relate to customer needs and concerns.



What We Offer:



*Salary offered: TBD depending on experience

*13th month performance based bonus paid in December

*Annual performance and salary review every June

*HMO with an additional dependent

*10 days Vacation leave

*5 days Sick leave

*3 days additional PTO (Christmas day, New Year’s day, & Good Friday)

*Full-time day shift (9:00 am to 6:00 pm - Australian Eastern Daylight Time (AEDT))

*Permanent work from home set-up



Home office requirements:

iCore 3 or it's equivalent with 4GB Ram

Internet speed should at least be at 50mbps



ONLY SHORT-LISTED CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED

title: Technical Site Builder (AI SEO)
description:
About the Role:

We’re hiring a Technical SEO Lead (Strategist–Operator) to own AI-era technical SEO across a WordPress multisite environment.

WordPress Multisite • Indexation • Schema • AI Overview Optimization





This is not a generic SEO role. You will:

-Design entity-first subdomain clusters

-Control indexation (canonical / meta-noindex / robots.txt / sitemaps)

-Shape JSON-LD schema for AI Overviews

-Keep WordPress multisite clean, structured, and fast

-Help operate an LLM toolchain (Claude Code + OpenRouter / Moonshot / Groq) for safe, cost-efficient AI content workflows



If you understand both technical SEO infrastructure and how AI impacts search visibility, this role is for you.



What You’ll Do:

-Architect 4–10 subdomain clusters using entity graphs + interlinking rules

-Implement & audit: Canonical tags, Meta noindex, Robots.txt, XML sitemaps (Google + Bing)

-Add & validate JSON-LD schema: Organization , Service, FAQ, HowTo

-Improve SERP + AI Overview eligibility

-Run Header Cleanup & Trust-Design (no duplicate modules, clean UX)

-Operate & optimize LLM routing: Provider switching , Cost caps , Token limits, Response timing logs

-Build SOPs + QA checklists

-Report weekly: Indexation KPIs , Crawl stats, Coverage changes



Must-Haves:

-Strong hands-on experience with: Canonical tags, Meta noindex, Robots.txt, XML sitemaps

-WordPress multisite experience

-Basic PHP / JS familiarity

-JSON-LD schema implementation (manual or plugin-based)

-Comfortable with LLM tools (any of): Claude Code, OpenRouter, Moonshot/Kimi, Groq

-Clear, concise English communication



Nice-to-Haves

-Bing or Google deindex recovery experience

-Entity clustering + AI Overview optimization knowledge

-Cost & logging discipline (rate limits, token control, latency tracking)



How We Work

Trust-first (no PBNs, no link rings, no paid guest-post farms)

Remote

Full-time (9–5 AEST)

Weekly KPI review

Time Tracker





Compensation

Technical SEO Lead (Strategist–Operator):

?50,000–?60,000/month

Up to ?60,000 for exceptional fit (proven indexation control + recovery + multisite ops)



Before submitting the application, please take the time to complete the test we provided. This will allow you to be invited to an application interview.



Use Subject Line: "I want to be part of the team" - Technical SEO

title: Property Manager Assistant
description:
Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Property Management Assistant to support property operations. The ideal candidate has experience in property management, strong administrative and accounting skills, and the ability to manage recurring operational tasks efficiently.



Key Responsibilities

• Assist with property management operations

• Provide administrative support, including documentation and record keeping

• Support accounting functions such as invoicing, payments, and expense tracking

• Assist with lease administration, including renewals and contract updates

• Coordinate routine property tasks and maintenance schedules

• Ensure timely execution of recurring responsibilities (e.g., monthly or seasonal tasks such as filter replacements and contract renewals)

• Communicate effectively with tenants, vendors, and internal teams



Qualifications

• Prior experience in property management required

• Strong administrative and organizational skills

• Basic to intermediate accounting knowledge

• Excellent attention to detail and time management

• Ability to manage deadlines and recurring responsibilities

• Strong written and verbal communication skills



Preferred Skills

• Property management software experience

• Ability to work independently and proactively

• Professional demeanor and discretion

• Accounting graduates

• Bookkeeping background

• Property Management VA

• Real estate admin assistant

• CPA assistant



How to Apply

Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience.
